title: I am looking for mutual alchemy and my cheerleader....
text:
I am looking for mutual alchemy and to be each other's mutual cheerleader but I think it's has to be mutual not one way.... 

Alchemy . . . "the process of taking something ordinary and turning it into something extraordinary, sometimes in a way that cannot be explained." This means I'm looking for a loving, caring, long term relationship with a single, funny, smart, educated woman with an irresistible charming personality, sense of adventure, and lots of common sense. 

When you pair up with someone and live through the day to day challenges of accepting, loving, and living with another person, you have the opportunity to create a beautiful life together out of the ordinary act of living rather than trying to "borrow" excitement, prestige, wealth, youth, or any other characteristic from the other person via "chemistry."

I am 6' tall, charismatic, broad shoulders, hazel-brown eyes, handsome, adventurous, funny, educated, sensual, cute, cultured, and a young working professional. I love traveling, languages, experiencing different cultures and food, helping others, giving back to the community, continuously learning, cooking, music, all things outdoors, keeping fit, and others. I believe that a successful relationship must have at a minimum the following elements:

1) Constant and honest communication - being vulnerable 
2) Zero lies, stealing, manipulating, trickery, or unethical behavior -- that means no white lies either
3) No screaming, violence or abuse of any kind -- there is never any reason for this.
4) An attitude of mutual reconciliation and a desire to makes things work

I'm looking for someone:

* who supports my career vision and allows me to support theirs
* with whom I can grow with and change together
* who shares my values (family, moral, others)
* who reminds me that I am not my accomplishments nor my degree(s), not my paycheck, not my job title, and especially not for my inheritance (I don't have one btw)
* who loves me for who I am 
* who remembers that it's important that we love one another not because of what we have done but because of who we are
* who wants to grow old and wrinkly together
* with whom I can adventure through life with as we grow and change, and with whom I can create something beautiful, extraordinary, and sometimes hard to explain
* who has no or minimal emotional baggage
* who understands that honest and constant communication is key to a successful, strong relationship

If this interests you, then to be fair, please write more than one line about yourself, share the basics (name, age, height, etc.), interests, what resonated with you, what you are looking for, what you have been doing with your life as well as where you'd like to go, any questions you have, and include a pic or two and I'll do the same. 

I live in the Washington DC area but I have family in the DFW area as well as travel there frequently for work. I'm willing to move there or anywhere for the right person so please don't let the distance be a deterrent to exploring if we might be right for each other.

I look forward to hearing from you.

text:
While my faith in finding a quality match on Craigslist is rather dismal, here goes nothing. 

I guess some info about me would be a good start. I'm 29, live in Frisco, work as a business process analyst for a fortune 500 company, have my own car, my own place, etc. I'm laid back and am also a bit of a nerd, which causes me to spend far too many hours in front of my TV either playing games on my Xbox or watching one of my many favorite shows/movies. I also love to travel and generally won't turn down an opportunity to get off the couch and enjoy what nature has to offer. 

I've spent the better part of the past year trying to get my life back in order, after a decade of partying and neglecting all personal responsibilities (which has gone extremely well). The only downfall to all of this is that I have neglected my social life so much that I'm down to a handful of good friends that I hangout with (not really the worst downfall, honestly), which means my dating life has become somewhat bleak as well (there's where the downfall comes into play). Due to this, I find myself on things such as OKCupid, Tinder and now Craigslist (is this considered rock bottom?). 

What I'm looking for in a lady friend? Well, that's a solid question, but I won't go too far into particulars as my taste tends to vary widely. However, with that said, I would like you to be laid back and somewhat intelligent. I'm not into crazy superficial people that need PRADA bags and Gucci shoes to feel like they've made it in life. I'd prefer someone that wears cheap flats and spends their money on making memories (i.e traveling, music festivals, Cons, etc). The intelligence part doesn't mean you have to have your masters in Molecular Biology or anything, just be able to hold a decent conversation about more than your chihuahua or the latest Kanye West drama. Also, good hygene, have it. Poor hygene is my number 1 turnoff. 

I don't know, I'm starting to ramble now, so I'm going to cut this short. I'm hoping that we can start out with a couple emails, maybe move to texting and see how we feel about meeting from there. If we clearly have a connection I will very much be down to chill as soon as you're comfortable with it. :)

Please include a pic in your response. I've gone as far as to publicly post mine, you can take the step to privately send yours. 

P.S.

I'm possibly a crazy cat man and a closet hippie. If you fit either of those, we should definitely be friends.

title: It's really hard to rise above the rest of the creeps
text:
Dating is hard. Trying to push yourself to meet a young lady is difficult because in the world of online dating, you have a bunch of creepy men flaunting their chops at a multitude of women overwhelmed by their number of prospects all the while being discouraged and frustrated at the continuous growth male mental midgetry. I have come to lean on online dating, whether it concerns craigslist or an online dating site. That said, I've decided to swing for the fences. How can I stand out from the rest of the creeps? I feel as though I have a lot to offer, but getting someone to give you a chance is a large hump to get over. Send someone a message. Who knows if she will even read it? Not a simple "hi" or "You're hot" but legitimate well thought out message that might make her do a double take. 

Love is a semi-myth. It seems like becoming a billionaire would take less time and less sweat. I have loved two women in my life, and it took two years to determine that's how I felt. So what am I doing here hoping for something that can grow from simple roots to one of those Northern California Redwoods, rising so high above the rest of the pedestrian foliage? I would just make this offer: let's talk and be friends. If there is compatibility, you know perfectly well it comes naturally, and if it does come, perhaps we are greeted by a feeling of affirmation that is strong and satisfying that is simply cannot spoken or written.

Still trying to rise above the creeps...

title: Have you heard, "Just Breathe" by Pearl Jam
text:
He sings with a passion. Of regret. A longing to make things clear. About coming clean. This is how I feel. Every time I go out on a beautiful day, see a movie, a longing to smile, and yet still alone. Regret, passion, and a longing to share these things with someone I might love. I look back at all the time spent looking for the "right one'. Never realizing who I might have loved if I had just come clean about my fears and concerns. 
Well... here are a few, 
1. Divorce. I always wanted that perfect special woman. To love me and I her unconditionally. To respect each other so that a voice is never raised. And this I have never found. The minute respect is lost I was always the one to walk away. Fearing things could only get worse. 
2. Family. Too many games have been played on me on this one. Don't get me wrong, I love kids. But the things that have been said and done out of a womans fear of raising a child can have long lasting scars. Its one thing to raise a child as your own and another to do so only to hear years later, "Oh, by the way" 
3.Trust. Because of the things I have seen I find this particularly difficult. I admit I have walls. And I would think that through the course of converation that these would be lowered. But that has not been the case. 
So, I guess what I am looking for is a woman that will be willing to work these things out with me. To help me learn how to love unconditionally. Without doubt or regret. 
My only requirements for you are few (being that this is on the net). 
1. That you be happy with yourself. either at 90lbs or xxlbs. As long as you can carry a great smile. 
2. MUST be local. 
3. Age is open as long as the conversation keeps. 
4. NO SMOKERS!! 
QUESTIONS?? Feel free to ask. 

I originally posted this a few months back. I have recieved a few positive responses. The only problem is that they were from out of state!! 
I am not asking for much, or am I? 
I would love some feedback. If you think you can carry on a conversation or have a few suggestions, then by all means, talk to me. Maybe you can help me to grow. And if you think "WE" might be compatible, then you will find me ready to grow with you.
I am R E A L and sincere. 
I am not willing to jump through hoops to be a friend.
Will not go to other sites to verify who I am or to see nude pictures of you. 
I can and will trade pictures but PLEASE send me your name when requesting. 
Its a sincerity issue.
Thanks!!

title: What happened to us kee kee?
text:
We got together because we couldn't stop loving each others company.
We talked about our favorite bands, clothes, style, health, food and have so much in common it's ridiculous.

I even love going to the thrift and antique malls with you, I love hanging out with you.

I never have to pretend that I love you, because I say it everyday without a stutter and hug you and kiss you as much as I can.

I don't know who you are now, you scare me and you have strange excuses for the things you do. 

I have an actual physical recording of you doing some really surprising stuff, and I'm not threatening you I'm saying you can't call me crazy I saw it with my eyes.

I just have to wonder how this is OK? How am I supposed to feel? I don't know what to say or do you just made a choice and poof I'm homeless, penniless, my things are scattered in 100 places, I have no job, no ID no help from anyone and my so called friends and even people I would have to imagine you're talking to have so much shit to say about me. 

It's not true, im not on drugs, im really wanting to fix this and get back on track. It wasn't enough time, we barely had time to settle in. 
Then I find that you're using? I don't understand have you always been? 

I'm so fucking lost and seriously confused and scared, I've walked the skin off my heels and twisted my hip and ankle. It's infected now and I washed my wounds in a 7-11 sink last night damn near screaming. I need to go to the hospital the car is totaled I have the number to the tow yard it's in. I am going to have to live in a shelter if I don't jump to my death first! 

I don't want this, I don't want to lose this, I will seriously do anything besides declare myself crazy to be with you. I already have a record now and you want me to throw the rest of my life away with it?! 

I am wondering do you love me? Did you ever? I mean maybe that sounds stupid but it was like one day you did then it was like someone told you I did something bad or I dunno and your attitude just changed like you hated me for something. 

I'm totally not kidding I'm completely confused at why you did these things? I've never ever seen or thought you were like this! Please look at it from my side for a second. 

You're all I have and all I've had for months, all I've dreamed of for years! I don't want to be someone that isn't helping but I'm literally in rags after all the legal shit. You know that and you know it's not up to me. 
If this is all because you think I didn't try hard enough then I am pretty sure this is the worst punishment I've ever felt for anything I've ever done. 

What's happening what have I missed? Who are we? What have you done? Did someone tell you to do this? Please help me understand what you want. 

I'm not joking I have no idea what happened to us it's like you woke up and forgot who I was. 

I feel like I'm dying out here, I'm worried, I feel abandoned by my beautiful wife and only family. I feel like nothing, no one, I'm so alone and I miss you so bad I can't stop thinking how you feel, or why, or what you want, or how I can stop this pain.

Oh please, I'm on my hands and knees praying that I wake up from this nightmare and stop this terrible fall into hell we are taking.

I havent prayed since I was a kid, this is the worst most terrible thing I can think of coming true and I don't know why!!!! Baby, are you really sure? Because I can't do this, I know I can't I won't leave my wife, my dream girl my favorite anything I've ever had. 

Please, stop this, I can't take this pain anymore I'm losing my thoughts my mind I'm slipping into a place that scares me I can't take much more my strength is almost gone.

I don't want to lose you, I don't want to die this way, I want to find the right path back to the man that can pull this ship with you. I can I have before this just needs more of a chance.

And if it has no answer, but silence, then I have to say. I have never known a bigger hole in me than the one you will leave if you go. And that's not your fault, I just have to tell everyone and you that I stayed true and stayed here by you and that I'll never give anyone that love again and have no problem imagining how I can prove that. 

I want no one but you, only your lips, only your arms, your eyes, only you. My wife

Please, don't leave me here in this darkness, I don't want to end like this I want you for the rest of my life. 

Please I can't last much longer out here like this, but my heart is the worst of it. 

Don't break it like this, not like this...... I love you my dream girl. 

I'm in hell without you, end it, or end me, it's not worth it being away from you now that I know what our love is.

And it is beautiful, don't cloud it with whispers from someone else look inside you and remember how much love we are. 

Stop this, you're the only one that can. I don't know what to do, and I'm scared of what's going to happen if we keep falling. 

I haven't been this scared in my entire life, don't send me away.

My name's Mikala, but most of the time my friends call me "Hey you." I'm five years old, with brown eyes, and I'm yellow. Not exotic or anything just.... Labrador yellow. Anyway, this is not about me, this is about my Human Companion. 

He's really cute, about 6' 2'' with short brown hair and is in his late 30's. I forget his actual age because I get busy doing other stuff like laying in the same spot for hours on end or chasing squirrels around the back yard in the middle of the night. Anyway, I want to tell you about him because I think there are a lot of reasons you should date him: 

1.	My HC is totally not getting what she needs from guy friends alone. I mean, of course they are invaluable, but there are obvious areas where guy friends don't cut it, and HC's guy friends are, well, manly. They're, like, the sort who watch anything sports and guy movies and stuff - whatever- *eye roll*. But my HC is more the if-something-isn't-blowing-up-in-the-first-fifteen-minutes-I'm-getting-bored and knows-all-the-lines-from-80's and 90's movies-type. 

2.	My HC is totally non-judgmental. I know, you're like, "this is about you being yellow, isn't it?" What is it with you humans and that stuff? Look, it's important if you have a sucky personality, if you're forehead-slappingly crackbrained, or if you have rather unfortunate personal hygiene habits, but it's not important what color you are. Anyway, can you remember where I was before I started ranting? Ah, yes-HC is non-judgmental. See, I have this personal thing. Ok, I'll say it. . . I'm a little paunchy in places. But, HC is totally cool with it. In fact, he calls my fatty bits "ploopy," isn't that cute? To hear him talk about it, you'd think ploopy was the solution to the world's problems. I think this is evidence that HC is a highly-evolved life-form. 

3.	My HC used to have this girl around that I called "mom," really only because it seemed to make him happy, but really I know she wasn't my mom. Anyway, the chick didn't like cook meals with him, I mean, is that even legal? He needs chicks who are low-key and not looking for a long-term, let's talk about our feelings, kind of thing. 

4.	A girl's gotta' eat. I mean, if he tries to pass celery and peanut butter off as a meal one more time, I'm calling someone. I'm not kidding, people, my paw is this close- THIS CLOSE. It's not like she can't afford something better, I get high-quality stuff in my bowl, man. And he's not one of those super-lame, new-diet-every-week, afraid-to-eat guys, either; he's a healthy eater, maybe even too healthy, I mean, I've never seen the boy turn down a cookie or piece of bacon. 

5.	Because God is fair. I mean look, yes he got a little too comfortable in his last relationship - what you're perfect. I seem to recall such things are important to you female-types. Of course, me, I'm a virgin, something about "being a responsible pet owner," whatever that means. . .but I digress. 

6.	My HC is running out of cool hobbies to pick up and I seriously do not want this getting out of control. He already travels. He takes me for walks all the time, we watch a lot of college sports and movies. He likes listening to music, and doesn't get all pretentious about what is "cool" to like and just digs the scene. Occasionally I catch him singing in the shower. And..Oh..My...God. I almost pee'd myself the first time it happened. 

He has lots of awesome friends who he hangs out with, so it's not like he's moping around longing for a woman to "complete" him or something. Really what I'm saying here is that I'd like to nip this "solo" thing he has going in the bud, before it starts down the path to crazy-town. . . 'cause I hate cats, man, and he's allergic, so this is a pre-emptive attack type thing. . . I am stealthy like a ninja. . . I creep in under cover of darkness using super-spy skills. . . ok, off vector again. 

7.	Because honestly, man, I am doing you a favor here. HC is a cool guy who is doing perfectly fine without you in his life, but maybe you're cool too and just want to eat some meals and have some fun. He's a funny and cute guy, so you might even get lucky, who knows. If his history is any indication, once she decides he's ready, he'll be back off the market in a snap, so this is really the best time to act, you know, while he's not really thinking about it too seriously. 

So anyway, I look forward to meeting you. Don't tell him I told you all this stuff 'cause he doesn't know anything about you yet and it will make him a little self-conscious. title: Why I'll never succeed in the W4M forum!
text:
I've been an avid reader, occasional poster and extremely rare responder of the Craigslist personals for about a year now, and I've noticed some common (and hilarious) threads of interest among the women of Dallas. I'd like to take a minute to break it down for you, ghetto style, so you can recognize the following horrific cliches and just maybe avoid getting flagged as spam.

ReadySetGo!!!!

"Seeking a man that's at least 6 feet tall. I like to wear high heels" -- Damn, totally boned here. I'm only 5'10 or maybe 5'11′, apparently equaling "somewhere between midget and elf, and therefore undatable", even though the average American male height is 5'10. And 6 feet tall? What kind of shoes are you wearing anyway? Some shit from the lunar landing? Next. . .

"Must love animals" -- Great. . . You mean I have to pretend to like your floofy poodle/chihuahua/norway rat mixed breed long enough to maybe earn some kisses? Or that huge mastiff that's physically capable of kicking me out of your bed? How about the cat that's contemplating using my balls as a scratching post every time I walk around in my boxers? I think I'll exit stage right before the fucker eats my socks again.

"Looking for a God-fearing man" -- I get the biggest kick out of this one. Why would you be afraid of your own imaginary friend? Seems like you'd better imagine something a little less hostile. I'd suggest Papa Smurf.

"Must like the outdoors" -- Barring a select few dweebs I've met that live in their parents' basement and mainline Mountain Dew so they can play World of Warcraft for 87 hours straight, most human beings like being outside at some point. Sure, I'll go for a day hike with you. Does that mean I want to live in the woods for a month and wipe my ass with a pine cone? No thanks!

"Looking for friends first" -- Cool, I'm always down for more friends. Wait, what's that you say? Your hot friend Brittany is single? Excuse me while I ask her for her phone number.

"Must love children" -- Unlike the mighty lion (who will kill and eat cubs from rival males) I say the more kids, the better! We can open our own sweatshop and they can make you shoes. I call being the manager!

"I like having fun" -- Whew, what a relief! I'm meeting too many people these days that think having fun sucks. I'm a big fan of fun myself! We have so much in common.

"Must like to dance" -- Really? Have you ever met a straight guy that wants to go dancing? Wait, I take that back. I do know one guy, but he's from Puerto Rico or something. Come to think of it, he's probably gay. That's right, Jorge -- I've got you figured out.

"I like going out, but also enjoy staying in for a quiet night at home" -- That's great, because staying home or going out and doing something are pretty much the only two options you have.

So in conclusion, I say the luck of the Irish be with you lovely ladies of Dallas in your search for a badass Daniel Craig-era James Bond lookalike that will dance the Macarena with Mr. Cuddlekins the Poodle whilst purchasing you an all-expenses-paid vacation to Maui. Just keep in mind that Mr. Bond is only 5'10.

Or you can drop me a line and we can chat.

title: Part-Time Exotic Dancer Seeks Pirate Side-Kick for Shennanigans
text:
Let's just address the items in the title first. I mean, it's that or the picture that got you to open this ad, so let's get that out of the way. 

First off, my exotic dancing career is on the skids. Back in the day, I was known as "The White Velvet Thunderclap", and was renowned across the lands as one of the top 5 exotic dancing/competitive lumberjack acts in the country. Unfortunately, as I have aged, and made increasing worse decisions regarding my agent, I'm now stuck on the retirement/nursing home circuit. If I get booked on another bingo night, I might just quit. Rappers like to make it "rain", but old bingo women make it "hail". On the bright Side: My ability to dodge a weakly thrown quarter is like a mongoose's ability to avoid a cobra strike, but there is nothing more shameful than dosing yourself with spray glue and rolling around on the ground to collect your night's earnings. *wipes tear* The thing that really hurts about the situation is that I think I've still got the juice to be one of the top dancer/competitive lumberjacks one the scene. I mean, just the other morning while still slightly intoxicated from a long night of drinking and watching youtube videos, I danced so hard to a Maroon 5 song in a 7-11 that I got a free slice of pizza. Those kinds of skills don't just fall off of the male exotic dancer tree. 

Now as far as what I am looking for, I need women to know that my Pirate status is totally legit. I'm not talking about a passing interest in a baseball team from Pittsburgh, I'm talking real pirate shit. The last time I threw a "pirate party", my costume was so authentic that I hijacked a passenger ship, and used it to rob a merchant vessel. The fact that the "passenger ship" strongly resembled a short bus full of handicapped children, and the "merchant vessel" happened to look like a food truck, have absolutely no bearing on the legitness of my pirate status. If I was any more pirate, I'd have won an Oscar for being in a movie with Tom Hanks. (Captain Phillips jokes? Anyone?)

So now that we've covered that, let's get to the point here. . .There was a point, right? Oh yeah, I am a 33-year-old, never-married, kid-less, professional writer/amateur comedian. I'm broadcasting myself to the internet because I spend a ton of time developing my career, and I honestly want to find an excuse to not work so damn much. Dating is stupid, and therefore, I don't do it. Not that writing personals ads is any smarter, I just know how to handle it. The internet is a scary place. . .That's why I wrote a book back in 2008 called "Bitches in Your Bushes: A Guide to Internet Dating". So when it comes to the internet, I'm as adept as Bear Grylls drinking his own pee. 

So let's assume you're not a creeper, and that hollowing out my body to make a canoe to float down a river in is not on your "to-do" list. Here's what I suggest: reply to this email with something more than "Hi, your funny", include a picture, and maybe you can be in the running to be my pirate sidekick. . .

title: SWM seeks SWF 32-40yrs
text:
Hello,

I don't know what it is lately... Maybe I need to lower my standards. Maybe I shouldn't. I am a successful (by many people's standards) professional SWM. 6ft 190lbs, fit/athletic type build. Straight teeth, clean cut, clean shaven. Apparently I look great in jeans and have nice shoulders? WTF?

The weird thing is I've been told I'm the type of guy that women think when they see me "He's gotta have a girlfriend or married". My profession (corporate) portrays me as being extremely outgoing, funny, and friendly. This too adds to the illusion that I am attached. Well I'm not. I've started many a conversation with ladies and after a while the interest is there from both sides. However, again nothing seems to come of it. 

I'm tired of hearing the saying "You're the type of guy a woman marries, not the type of guy a woman dates" I think this is so foolish because I don't intend to meet someone and get married the same weekend. So I looked this up and came across a few interesting things about this comment. 

A woman wants to marry a stable, kind, attentive, smart, and loving man.

A woman wants to date an asshole, jerk, self-centered, abusive, fucktard that she has absolutely no interest in pursing anything serious with. "And she begs for that!"

Well, I'm not about to start being that second guy, it isn't in my nature at all. So here I am. The type of woman I am seeking apparently isn't out of my league. 32-40yrs old, Caucasian, between 5'3" and 5'9" and in good shape. We are attracted to certain types, I didn't say super model. Although my previous relationship was with a former model, that didn't make her perfect by any means. Sure she had a great "shell" but it didn't take away the crab inside it. 

Maybe I am ranting and raving, I don't know anymore. If you want to reply please DO NOT include an email for me to reply to and at least change the subject line to your favorite sport.

title: Busy Professional Looking to Find a Friend
text: Wow. When this thought first popped into my head, it all seemed so simple. So logical. So easy. But when I sat down to post it, my fingers stopped above the keyboard keys because I had absolutely NO idea what to write or how to say it. As I got to thinking about all the factors, perceptions, taboos and opinions that might come firing back at me, I had to really stop and consider if it was worth pursuing or not. But then I decided, why not. It's truly what I'm looking for and it's truly what I'd like. So, ultimately, I just decided to lay it all out on the table. So here goes....I'm a 40-something professional white male who works 60-80 hours a week depending on any given week. As much as I'd like to and want to, I unfortunately don't have the time for the traditional dating scene. I don't have that luxury of time that it takes to find, meet, greet and have the pleasure of the traditional dating timelines. But I do miss female company. I know what you're probably thinking right now. "Oh, so you just want to find someone to sleep with you whenever you feel like it and with no questions asked." NO. That's absolutely not it. Like any man, I have desires, but is that the goal or end game of this post? NO. I miss the joy of spending quality time with a woman. The intelligent conversation. The unbridled laughter. The smell of her perfume. The allure of a flirtatious wink. The way they think and look and feel about topics and the world around them. The way they can soften a room or unleash their persona upon it at their whim. That's part of what I'm looking for. So, no. It doesn't mean sleeping together. Do I have things I would enjoy? Yes of course, but they don't entail you having to sleep with me.Who am I? I'm in my 40's. I'm a college educated professional white male who prefers jeans and a polo to suits and ties. I devour great conversation...wherever that topic path meanders to...History...Books...The Arts...Pop Culture..Current Events...the Paranormal....as long as none of it includes frequent bouts of Negativity, Drama or Self-Loathing. And I'm also a big fan of With, Humor and Witty Banter. I'm tall, athletic and in very fit condition. I don't smoke, but I don't mind if you do. I am a Social Drinker. I enjoy movies, karaoke (not singing, just watching!), exploring the town and taking in the sights.With all of this said, I know that your time is valuable too. It's the world we live in. Very few of us have a great deal of idle time. Call it Therapy. Call it whatever you wish. I am just appreciative to have someone to spend some quality time with. Ultimately, I'd like to get together 1-3 times a month for a few hours. I am usually most available in the evenings, but sometimes have weekends available. I'd like to spend time with someone who is intelligent, confident, funny, outgoing, self-assured, passionate about life and adventurous. I'd enjoy hearing back from anyone who this interests.

title: It's really hard to rise above the rest of the creeps
text:
Dating is hard. Trying to push yourself to meet a young lady is difficult because in the world of online dating, you have a bunch of creepy men flaunting their chops at a multitude of women overwhelmed by their number of prospects all the while being discouraged and frustrated at the continuous growth male mental midgetry. I have come to lean on online dating, whether it concerns craigslist or an online dating site. That said, I've decided to swing for the fences. How can I stand out from the rest of the creeps? I feel as though I have a lot to offer, but getting someone to give you a chance is a large hump to get over. Send someone a message. Who knows if she will even read it? Not a simple "hi" or "You're hot" but legitimate well thought out message that might make her do a double take. 

Love is a semi-myth. It seems like becoming a billionaire would take less time and less sweat. I have loved two women in my life, and it took two years to determine that's how I felt. So what am I doing here hoping for something that can grow from simple roots to one of those Northern California Redwoods, rising so high above the rest of the pedestrian foliage? I would just make this offer: let's talk and be friends. If there is compatibility, you know perfectly well it comes naturally, and if it does come, perhaps we are greeted by a feeling of affirmation that is strong and satisfying that is simply cannot spoken or written.

Still trying to rise above the creeps...

title: Something meaningful and passionate.
text:
Even though you are supposed to be happy with yourself before you can be happy with someone else, companionship is something I for one need and want, as does just about everyone else in the world. The question of compatibility and chemistry arise, of course. I'm looking for that compatible friend with the elements on the table that can complicate the ones I have. You only know if there's a match if we talk and spend a little time together. We cannot go into a laboratory and conduct experiments. My ideal woman would be between 18 and 40 with a love for cuddling, deep intimacy in an emotional and physical sense, a desire to see the world and take road trips and someone who loves animals. 

Healthy companionship shortens the distance from my outstretched arm to the realm of happiness.

title: A friend that's a girl
text: Well, there's nothing original about that. There are times when I feel like I conform to the typical craigslist creep, because to be honest, there's no normality to me in more ways than one. I'm a bit obsessive over things such as working out and sex. One of those things I do everyday, and there's another I'm hardly getting. It's a harsh and uncomfortable reality that I'm not sure I could just meet somebody for sex, so I guess I'll need to make a friend and see of there's any chemistry. If there is that necessary compatibility, after we have met for coffee or tea or walk in the park or after weeks of flakey texting and the occasional chat on the phone, maybe I can kiss you or hold you or something else? It's not an ad for sex. It's an ad for something that can lead to passion and deep love, physically and emotionally.

title: It's really hard to rise above the rest of the creeps
text:
Dating is hard. Trying to push yourself to meet a young lady is difficult because in the world of online dating, you have a bunch of creepy men flaunting their chops at a multitude of women overwhelmed by their number of prospects all the while being discouraged and frustrated at the continuous growth male mental midgetry. I have come to lean on online dating, whether it concerns craigslist or an online dating site. That said, I've decided to swing for the fences. How can I stand out from the rest of the creeps? I feel as though I have a lot to offer, but getting someone to give you a chance is a large hump to get over. Send someone a message. Who knows if she will even read it? Not a simple "hi" or "You're hot" but legitimate well thought out message that might make her do a double take. Love is a semi-myth. It seems like becoming a billionaire would take less time and less sweat. I have loved two women in my life, and it took two years to determine that's how I felt. So what am I doing here hoping for something that can grow from simple roots to one of those Northern California Redwoods, rising so high above the rest of the pedestrian foliage? I would just make this offer: let's talk and be friends. If there is compatibility, you know perfectly well it comes naturally, and if it does come, perhaps we are greeted by a feeling of affirmation that is strong and satisfying that is simply cannot spoken or written.

Still trying to rise above the creeps...

title: Let's start out as online friends.
text:
If you just want to skim, read the parts inside **double asterisks**.


WHAT I'M LOOKING FOR

**Eventually, a romantic and sexual long-term relationship.** I want someone who I can share my deepest feelings with, and who I can bond with physically through cuddling, sex, and kissing. When I say 'romantic', I don't mean roses and chocolates, I mean in the sense that some people are aromantic.

**Someone willing to talk online while I get comfortable around them.** I'm really, really shy, and I'd like to get to know you online first, so I can feel more comfortable around you and decide if we're a good match. This might take a really long time, while I gradually get used to talking to you.

**Someone within driving distance.** This is a pretty flexible criterion, but I just don't want to be stuck in a long-distance relationship. One of the big reasons I'm looking for someone is for physical intimacy. Not just sex, but also cuddling, hugging, kissing, etc.

**Someone over the age of consent.** This one's pretty self-explanatory.

**Someone who I can have interesting conversations with.** I hate to say this sort of thing, but a lot of topics just aren't all that interesting to me. I like to talk about really technical stuff like cellular automata, computer programming, and what an AI might be like. If that sort of thing isn't for you, I'm also interested in just sharing and talking about interesting ideas. Stuff like TED talks or weird mathematical proofs. Or even just comparing our personalities and life experiences.


WHAT I DON'T CARE ABOUT, OR DON'T MIND

**Appearance.** I want someone who I find mentally attractive. Not (necessarily) physically.

**If you're older.** There are a lot of societal values that I think are silly, and this is one of those. At the moment, I can't think of any reason why I /shouldn't/ date older women, so I'm happy to do just that.


ABOUT ME

**INTP.** Yeah, the MBTI is deprecated. But it's what everyone's familiar with.

**Kind of a geek.** Well, actually that's an understatement. I like anime, Let's Plays, video games, D&D, computer programming, scifi, etc.

**Social anxiety, big time.** I'm extremely shy, even online. Talking to people is really scary to me, and responding to messages takes a lot of courage, so don't be surprised if I take a long time to respond. Because of that, it's generally better to send longer messages, since it's just as easy for me to reply to a long message than a short one, and with a long message I have more to reply /to/, if that makes sense. Also, I might stop replying altogether, but that's not because I don't like you or you said the wrong thing. It's just because I got a little too stressed and had to stop.

**Sort of a gothy side.** I tend to wear lots of black and monochrome, I generally listen to dark or sad music, I like /some/ horror movies (but I'm really picky), and I'm a big fan of Lovecraftian horror.

**I'm an open book.** You can ask anything you want, and I'll give an honest answer. It can be sexual, awkward, weird, or even nosey. I can't think of anything that I wouldn't be happy to talk about.

title: Dilbert approved comic
text:
I don't have an agenda for a relationship and I'm not working a plan to be married. What I'm hoping for is a happy healthy relationship with my best friend. Everything in the relationship will come in its own natural timing. I believe that if it is the right person then the relationship just works. Everything will go exactly how it should in a very uneventful yet special way.

I've spent some time working through some challenges that I believe has made me very happy; yet I wouldn't hope for my worst enemy to go through the same stuff. I am really grateful for the life I have. I want everything that I have. I feel like I'm living my dream.

I have my own business, which I love. I love going to work. I also love coming home to spend time with my dogs, friends and family. Like everyone else, I enjoy traveling and I want to see as much of the world as I can. I love animals, except snakes, which I only like at the zoo. Otherwise, I'll shoot the poisionous ones. I don't like killing animals and will avoid it as much as possible. One day I hope to have my own exotic wildlife rescue. I have no idea if that will come true but it's a goal. 

I'm looking for a woman who is comfortable and confident. She should have some kind of connection to a higher power and rely on that connection every day. It doesn't matter if it is Jesus or something else but the connection to a higher power is important. We would have an emotional and physical connection that feels right. Even when we're fighting. She will hopefully love me where I'm at and accept me as I come and as I grow. I want my best friend to be my wife who I tell everything to but she will never replace or substitute my guy friends. I want someone who wants to be with me but is perfectly fine without me.

70% of the time I think I want kids. 30% of the time I'm glad I don't have kids because I can barely get myself ready for work in the morning. 

I say the F* word. Sometimes alot but I have a good filter for when and where.

I'm bad at writing and my grammar stinks. I know the difference between you're and your but I also don't always proofread my texts. If that's going to bother you, then piss off. I dont take myself that serious and you shouldn't either. I hate making mistakes but I also laugh at all the stupid things I do.

I believe in giving and being generous when I can. However, I don't believe in giving money to large organization that cannot keep their expenses low. I'd much rather help a someone on the street but I know that can backfire. So, I'm careful to who and how I give.

title: Needle in a haystack
text:
Hello, I'm that elusive, needle in a haystack, CL dude. No, not some millionaire, twentysomething, jet setter that will sweep you off your feet and whisk you away to the land of your dreams; there is no such haystack and those needles do not reside on CL. 

I am simply an attractive, intelligent, respectful man that will make you wonder, "How is HE on Craig's list". So, let me tell you why and then I'll get to the all-important stats. I'm on CL because I've been divorced about two years now and I'm not ready to get married again. That eliminates the dating sites. I've tried them and gone out with some fabulous women, however those sites are for marriage or casual encounters. I'm not into either of those. I've been reading CL post for years as a simple distraction and occasional belly laugh. I would never respond because of all the fakes/crazies, then I had an epiphany, there are probably women like me doing the same thing. Never daring to respond or post, just reveling in the insane human experiment which is Craig's List personals.

Who I am: 40 (but get mistaken for early 30's) I work out 5 times a week and eat well. I'm white 6'1" and am 185 to 200 lbs. depending on if I'm lifting or focusing on cardio. I'm educated, intelligent, and a great conversationalist. I have a wide variety of interests and guarantee we will have something in common.

Who you should be: Kind (I'd like to restore my perception of the fairer sex which inevitably gets distorted after a break-up) above average looks due to a healthy life style. Around my age. Not wanting to get married at the moment but miss going out with a similarly situated man. Pretty simple, we should be able to figure the rest out over coffee to start, then a few dinners. Holy shit!! That sounds like two normal people dating, I am completely destroying the long established tradition of dysfunction on this site. For this I apologize and will let you name your cats after me or poop on my toes when the time is right; or whatever feels natural to all of you wonderful ladies of Craig's List. 
Yay, I have taken the plunge. Let the games begin! Send a pic, I'll send one back, easy enough.

title: Best Post on CL, and 100% Dong Free!!
text:
I guess I'll answer a few questions you probably have right off the bat. Yeah, I've done this before. Yeah, I've met people who have replied to an ad I've posted. Yeah, I've woken up with pictures of my penis on my cell phone with no idea how they got there.

Now, I with a doubt know that I have written 3 of the 7 greatest personals ads of all times. This has been proven by a panel of experts that have studied every craigslist ad ever written. Now a lot of people have been giving me shit about the fact that the "panel of experts" only consists of my dating counselor, or Grandma as I call her, and my 11 year old lab mix mutt. Sure - it's a narrow panel, but I'm here to tell ya: these old broads know their shit. 

I've also gotten flack about the fact that their collection of study material consists of most of the shit posted in yesterdays "intimate encounters" section, and a couple of random posts from ilikewearingdiapers.com . That being said, to have some of my previous posts stand up against random wang pictures and the morbid curiosity of grown men soiling diapers, I have to believe that I've got the goods. . .

you See, writing personals ads for me is a release of sorts. It's my way of sharing myself with potential life mates without the awkwardness of getting maced in a moderately priced Mexican food restaurant. Which has only happened twice, and the second time was by the waitress. Apparently ordering a side of "your lovely lady lumps" is lost in translation.

Based on scientific research, I think that the most important part of a personal's ad (other than a valid email address) is to catch enough attention to justify a response. That is simple as a concept, but has proven difficult in previous attempts. With the modern attention span being about 12.3 seconds, and my specific breed of comedy (that has been tested and evaluated in the roughest comedy situations across the state) taking about 3 minutes to tell a joke, I surmise that my attempts at written humor are lost. By the way, if you haven't figured it out by now, I'm smarter than all of your ex-boyfriends..

Then again, I wonder if smart is sexy anymore? I mean, I could throw on an Affliction T-shirt and a straight-billed hat that has rhinestones on it, and be as attractive as 97% of the average douchebags on the planet...

My dating life in the past has been an assorted affair. Literally everything from two and three year-long relationships to two and three day drunken flings with women who may or may not have known my real name. I've even dated twins. Actual twins. Both of them at the same time. I mean sure they were Siamese twins but it didn't make the sex any less kinky. Some people thought it was weird that they shared a liver and spleen, and I always said to those people "that's not all they share, HA"

As a hard working 32 year old single man who has never been married and has no children, my life can get lonely at times. Loneliness does weird things to a man, which is why I've turned to online dating. The first girl I met on the internet sent me a bunch of pictures. She was HOT in the pictures, and all of my buddies said "Dude, you know it's probably a fat guy who lives in his mom's basement". Well I got the last laugh, because she was actually an anorexic chick living in her dad's attic. Nothing like the sweet taste of winning an argument. . 

Let's be real for a minute though... Being a writer in a cyber-dating environment is like being a whole wheat bagel in the middle of a donut shop. You might be the only thing with substance, but your chances of getting purchased are right up there with the chances of a one-legged fat kid winning the Dayton 500 on a bicycle. 

I even tried one of those "chat lines" you see on TV late at night if you are watching any type of programming that caters to anything with a penis. I figured "what's the worst that could happen?", much like I do in 98% of the decisions I make, and dialed away. My luck, I got a girl that stuttered. Worst 342 dollars I've ever spent. Not being a quitter, I tried it again and I got a woman who was schizophrenic. . . halfway through a conversation of the dirty, dirty things that would happen if we were to ever be in the same place at the same time she called me a dirty bastard hung up the phone. I think the worst was when I got the girl with ADD. She'd climaxed twice and was talking about bicycles before I even got my pants unzipped. The only good experience I've had was that the other night I called and got a woman from Pakistan. The Kama Sutra was created in the Middle East so you can imagine what went on there. . .yeah, she walked me through how to fix my computer.

I guess before this ad reached some unknown word limit, or you decide to wander off and look at wang pictures - I'll give you a little insight to the man behind the beard:
1. As I mentioned, I have an incredible beard. It makes at least ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â‚ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â¾ of my decisions on a daily basis, and houses almost all of my mojo. How Important is a beard? Chuck Norris? Beard. Gandalf? Beard. Jesus? I've made my point.
2. I have woken up on a horse in Mexico. This isn't that amazing of a feat unless I mention the fact that I fell asleep in Texas.
3. I was once arrested for hitting a man in the face with my Mackerel. He had to get stitches.
4. "Mackerel" is not a euphemism for "penis", but "golf cart" can be.
5. I've done more dangerous things on a golf cart than the average man has done in his life. Shit, I shouldn't have mentioned "golf cart as a penis euphemism" thing in the last one huh? Now it sounds like I do dangerous things on penises, which I do not. . .
6. Although I never took credit for it in a song, I in fact, brought sexy back. And then I issued a groupon for a "buy one sexy, get a second sexy for your dumpy friend half off".
7. When I was 20, and caught drunk by local police, I put a beer bottle label on my head, and told them I was "on the patch". They left immediately.
8. I've made more than one person laugh so hard they peed on themselves. This week. 
9. My homemade sausage based Italian meat sauce has won battles. Mostly online battles, between myself and 14 year olds while playing Call of Duty, but still. . .
10. When I make a milkshake, all the boys come to my yard. And they are always like, "it's better than yours". And then I ask "who's? who the hell are you talking about. . .why are you in my yard?", and they are like "can you teach us?" and I'm like, "yeah, but there is a price. . .."
11. I've sang on stage with a band on purpose.

title: An open letter from "Prince Charming"...
text:
To my future Princess...

I am a dynamic figure, often seen scaling walls and crushing ice. I have been known to remodel train stations on my lunch breaks, making them more efficient in the area of heat retention. I translate ethnic slurs for Cuban refugees, I write award-winning operas, I manage time efficiently. Occasionally I tread water for three days in a row.

I woo women with my sensuous and God-like trombone playing. I can pilot bicycles up severe inclines with unflagging speed and I cook thirty-minute Brownies in twenty minutes. I am an expert in Stucco, a veteran in love and an outlaw in Peru.

Using only a hoe and a large glass of water, I once single handedly defended a small village in the Amazon basin from a horde of ferocious army ants. I play bluegrass cello. I was scouted by the Braves. I am the subject of numerous documentaries. When I am bored, I build large suspension bridges in my yard. I enjoy urban hang gliding. On Wednesdays, after work, I repair electrical appliances free of charge.

I am an abstract artist, a concrete analyst, and a ruthless bookie. Critics worldwide swoon over my original line of corduroy evening wear. I don't perspire. I am a private citizen, yet I receive fan mail. I have been caller number nine and I have won the weekend passes. Last summer I toured New Jersey with a traveling centrifugal force demonstration. I bat .400. My floral arrangements have earned me fame in international botany circles. Children trust me.

I can hurl tennis rackets at small moving objects with deadly accuracy. I once read Paradise Lost, Moby****and David Copperfield in one day and still had time to refurbish an entire dining room set. I know the exact location of every food item in the supermarket. I have performed several covert operations for the CIA. I sleep once a week; when I do sleep, I sleep in a chair. While on vacation in Canada, I successfully negotiated with a group of terrorists who had seized a small bakery. The laws of physics do not apply to me.

I balance, I weave, I dodge, I frolic and my bills are paid. On weekends to let off steam, I participate in full contact origami. Years ago I discovered the meaning of life but forgot to write it down. I have made extraordinary four course meals using only mold and a toaster oven. I breed prizewinning clams. I have won bullfights in San Juan, cliff-diving competitions in Sri Lanka and spelling bees at the Kremlin. I have played Hamlet. I have performed open heart surgery, and I have spoken with Elvis... but I have never...tasted...the sweetness of your lips." =)

Isn't attraction incredible? Imagine relaxing into strong arms holding you, feeling safe and appreciated and intimate, knowing you're exactly where you belong... I'm educated, successful, emotionally mature, and I know what I want. My work keeps me busy, but I make time for travel, dining out, music (very diverse tastes), and anything new and interesting. I'm in great shape, with brown eyes and brown hair.

Wanna good laugh? We should play golf... my game SUX!

Some of my "keywords" are: 

Food: Thai, Vietnamese, Indian, Korean, Italian, Mexican, Sushi/Sashimi...hell, just about everything. I do love to cook....my skills in the kitchen keep the local Fire Department in top form!

Music: Creed, TuPac, PDiddy, Staind, Kid Rock, Alicia Keys, Journey, Rush, AC/DC, Randy Travis...even on rare occasions...classical.

I work, play and love hard. Do you??? 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Btw, My name is Joe. If you think you'd like to get to know me, shoot me a reply with pics and I'll reciprocate with mine. You'll be glad you did!

title: Nearing 50 Or 50+ Doesn't Mean the Romance & Sizzle is Over...Does It?
text:
Okay. Before I begin my post, I feel the need to vent a little. Call it frustration. Call it exasperation. Call it what you will. Is it just me, or does it feel like EVERYone in our age bracket falls into three -or a combination of them - distinct categories. 1) The Venomous Ex - She who spends all of her time and energy talking about what an a-hole her ex was and how she will rain havoc down upon him if only she gets the chance. Gee...there's a bubbly personality you want to spend quality time with, right?
2) The Naysayer - No matter what is going in the world, the state, the city, or her life, she has a paragraph of doom just waiting to spew about the subject. The world is a pit. Everything is bad. All people are horrible. Hey!...can I party with You?!?
3) The Dudette (female for Dud) - Excitement for her is defined by the 6:30 Episode of Inside Edition or what happened last week on The Good Wife. She doesn't go out. She doesn't enjoy anything spontaneous or new. She isn't into kid-like giggling or being silly every now and then. And God forbid you mention sex, sensuality or lust. Can you say lights off, under the covers?Well. That actually went longer than I planned, but I hope I got my point across. If you are one of the aforementioned three; well then, good for you. But, you're not my type. With all of this said, I'm absolutely positive that the ladies out there could write an equally pointed and scathing report of men in this age bracket. But hey, let's get past - way past - all of this negativity. I'd like to move on to more positive things.I have extreme confidence that there are women out there who read what I wrote and said to themselves, "I'm not any one of those!" Excellent. I'm very happy to hear that. You are the type of woman I would love to meet and get to know.As for me, I am a divorced white male in his late 40's who has a college degree; is well-read; loves long conversations about topics that meander and flow with points, counterpoints & anecdotes; can enjoy museums and theater as much as I enjoy drinking a frosty one inside some hole-in-the-wall hangout; likes college sports over pro sports; can probably help you pick out something to wear without looking like a total fashion idiot; loves silly jokes & funny gags; has a witty and sometimes blue sense of humor; appreciates the gawking fascination of a good conspiracy theory or ghost story; understands the intimacy and connection of pillow talk; likes the - perhaps some might think it sexist - 'protector' feeling I have as a man when I'm with a woman; and would always open the door for a lady. I am tall. I am athletic and fit. I do not have the body of a 25-year-old, but I don't have the body of your typical 40-something either. I'm not balding. I'm not into NASCAR (not that there's anything wrong with NASCAR). I don't live paycheck to paycheck. I don't play Fantasy Football. I don't ride Harleys - though I do know how. I like to drive fast, but I'd never put someone in danger to do so. I don't pshaw the beauty of the change of seasons. I can tell one fabric from another - within reason of course! I won't take you for granted, but I'm not a text-me-twenty-times-a-day person either. I'm just me. And I'm happy with that.If any of this piqued your interest, tickled your funny bone, or evoked a few warm butterflies, I'd really enjoy hearing from you. I hope.....hope there's still someone out there.

title: Natural Dominant male seeking a lady with a mix
text:
I'm a successful, educated professional guy who is often called charming, hilarious, genuine, amazing and a whole series of other adjectives I'm constantly amazed people associate with me. At the end of the day I'm pretty modest but I have to sell myself here, and all banter aside I'm probably one of the most loyal, mentally stable, creative and capable guys who is actually single and looking to settle down. I'm also a lover of variety. As for details... average build, 6'4, brown eyes, dark hair, etc.

I seek one very special girl to share adventures with... be they in the bedroom or out. Someone bright, witty, beautiful who is drug and smoke free, active, in decent shape and who is looking for something genuine on both a kink and vanilla level. Ideally she'll enjoy the outdoors, be able to tolerate cheesy plays and maybe even enjoy drama movies... but most importantly she'll be loyal, honest and loving. Ideal range is late 20's to late 30's.

Historically I've generally ended up in relationships w/painfully vanilla girls, mainly due to the difficulty associated with finding sane kinky ones I'm actually interested in. Unfortunately, I often end up frustrated in those relationships... I don't need to suspend you from the ceiling and whip your toes while wearing a Santa suit as 12 people dressed like kinky elves beat each other with giant candy canes or anything too elaborate, but someone willing to entertain a little spanking, rope, handcuffs, etc in the bedroom would be oh-so-nice. I've tried a lot over the years, and I'm pretty open to my partner's desires, but my expectations are fairly realistic. I'm cautiously optimistic that if I put myself out here like this I might finally meet that perfect balance of vanilla and kink to settle down with. Also, because it's important, I fall on the Top side of the spectrum. 

Other vanilla things... I'm spontaneous, love to travel, embrace road trips at the last minute, enjoy hiking, kayaking, jet skiing, and pretty much anything else that exposes me to nature and/or gets my pulse running. 

You want to know more? I've already written a novel. Well, then I suppose you have no choice but to message me, eh? I'm very nice and will respond to all messages. I'm very serious about finding someone special and for those who consider me, I will return the interest in kind and always let you know where I stand. Obviously I would love a picture of you and am more than happy to share one in return. I'm looking for someone genuinely special here - is that you? My main goal is to find a genuinely good person to have an amazing life with, inside and more importantly, outside of the bedroom. . 

Oh, and make the subject line "W&C" to help me weed out the spam... and yes, that's Whips and Chains, but I want to keep it work friendly for you naughty girls browsing Craigslist in the office ;-)

Hope you enjoyed your New Year and looking forward to a new journey.

title: Took Me A Minute, But I got It
text:

No kids, 2 cars, decent career, 6 feet tall and 267..broad shouldered and a littel chubby but good looking non the less, I even wear the five o'clock scruffy shadow thing for the super manly effect for my baby face...lol...but seriously...Valentine's Day is right around the corner, and I would like nothing more than to be sitting at the lake with you laughing the night away, but truth is, I would love to get to know you first. The art of a real courtship is dead and gone. For most it's the instant gratification era. Men expect to get into your pants no later than the second date, and women have become the ultimate "I need my" machines...not all, I would never be silly enough to say all, but most...This may not be you but we all know men that have said " I'm tryna fu#k sumthin...or I want dem panties..or worse yet the dreaded..you gone gve me some pu$$y.." and how many girlfriends you have that say "I need my nails done(or did depending on which side of town you on) ..my hair done, my phone bill light bill paid..or worse yet, the girl that goes on the first date and doesnt bring any money..orders everything and expects the guy to pay....Not because it's the chivalrous thing to do, but just because she had no intent of paying...

I said all of that to say, people totally skip the getting to know you phase of dating...The let's text, talk, email phase. The meet at the coffee shop for a no pressure first meeting phase. Maybe I am old fashioned but I just don't believe that a movie is a great first date. It doesn't take long to see if there is chemistry..Put fire and gunpowder together, you get BOOM..doesn't take long...you don't have to grow on me..or get me warmed up to you. Fire is hot instantly. title: Is there such a thing a casual encounter?
text:
I don't know what the "casual" in "casual encounters" means. It seems to mean "lets fuck" (perhaps not the OED definition, but still, in spirit) and I currently don't have a use for that. Something dirty and quick seems exciting, sure, but I could get drunk in a bar and snag someone with ease, and then wake up the next morning fuzzy on the details of what happened, who this person is or if I even enjoyed myself, and then count the hours til Target opens so I can buy new sheets and a soda-pretzel combo.

I like casual as in, informal. Relaxed. I don't want to marry you, but I'd like to get to know you. I'd like to like you, as a person. I'd like to be attracted to you without beer goggles, and I'd like you to be attracted to me without them as well. I'd like be comfortable with you, to ease into sex with you, and then make it a regular thing that we both enjoy. I'd like there to be honesty and openness and fun and laughter. Just, you know. Naked, sometimes.

This is sounding a little relationship-py. Maybe these are silly things to be looking for, in this section. I'd like you to sleep in my bed and warm my sheets, but I don't want you to leave your toothbrush. I want to kiss you on the mouth, but I don't care if you sleep with other guys or if you are in a relationship just looking for a passion filled evening. What is that? A friend with benefits? Super low key dating? Consistent naked exercise?

Is that casual, do you think? 

Allen, McKinney, Wylie, Murphy, Plano, Frisco, Richardson

title: Let's be honest
text:
99% of the women seeking men ads of here are scammers and spammers so I thought I would put my own ad up and see who is real out there. I am a single, never married, AA male, mid 30's, no kids, good job, own my vehicle, and yada yada yada so forth and so on. You know, the things that women claim they are looking for, basically I am.

Now on to what I am looking for:
A friend first and formost. I really want someone that I can go to the movies with, out to dinner, have over to my house and cook for. Bowling, shooting pool, laser tag, and a lot of other corny things just because we are adults and we can do what we want. I am not looking for a FWB, but if aomething of that nature happens I would rather it be with someone I consider a friend. I have to be honest here and say that I am open to any race of woman but I do have my own preferences. 

Your qualities/characteristics:
Single, have a job, have a vehicle, does not live with parents, able to hang out more than once a week, likes silly/corny stuff, likes random texting or calling just because, fan of "The Walking Dead", basically someone that wants to have fun and make a new bestie.

I ask that if you are interested please include a picture with your response and change the subject to anything of your liking so I know that you are not fake. I appreciate if you read all the way through this story, and trust me if we connect it will be worth it.

title: Mid Life Crisis
text: Looking to start dating again; been divorced a few years and done screwing around. Looking for someone with her head screwed on straight, her life in order, no young kids at home, a job, not a lot of debt, no drama in her life (other than what to make for dinner each night). I work with several hundred people, so internet dating is awkward since the last time that I posted my picture, everyone started offering their opinion on how to rewrite my ad so I would find what they were looking for, so you send me your pic and I'll show you mine (but no nudes because if you haven't seen a penis, you're either too young for me or too screwed up). One thing that I have learned about dating at this point in my life is the older we get, the more insecure that we are. I need to lose some weight and enjoy sex, along with cuddling and other intimate activities with the right partner; but I like the lights to be on, I like being someone who is comfortable with her own skin, who doesn't feel like we have to have sex every time that we're together and enjoys going to the movies, street fairs and playing board games while eating fondu and drinking wine. I'm not into threesomes, foursomes, groups, public sex but do like holding hands and trying different things with my partner (reasonable). I am Caucasian and prefer the same - I've dated outside of my race and while there was nothing wrong between myself and who I was dating, friends and family on both sides usually do have a problem, so it's better to keep things simple. I prefer a woman who has a natural figure, meaning that I'm not into enhanced or huge boobs, big butts or too overweight. I am a non-smoker and prefer the same. I like a occasional glass of wine but am not a heavy drinker. I'm not rich so please don't expect that I will pay for every date and do budget for a few trips a year. If you're into a lot of texting, always going to fancy restaurants, expect a guy to always pick up the check, a guy who always buys you little gifts, will ask you about your day and not get pissed when you never ask about his then we're probably not a good match. When I meet someone, I like spending two or three nights a week together but have a life with friends and a life with balance.

title: Taking the CL Plunge are You?
text:
I have my doubts that posting on CL is right place for me but I thought that perhaps there are others here that are looking for similar things as me. One never knows unless they try so I am testing the CL waters. 

So about me, if I pique some interest write me and lets see where it goes. I am a business professional, white and a young 50ish. I am laid back, social and I like to have fun. I travel occasionally for business purposes, enjoy vacationing both here and abroad. I also, enjoy the little things in life; flea markets, a walk on the beach, renting a mobile RV or a luxury cabin for a short quick get away or a cruise, long or short. I am divorced for about seven years now and I have children that don't live with me however, they are an important part of my life. Oh and I have a dog so you should be comfortable with dogs too. I am drama free and you should be too. I understand that we all go through life and occasionally have problems but if you're the everyday drama type we just won't work. I enjoy the traditional role of relationships, yes I will open doors for you, I will hold your hand and kiss you in public too if we develop a closeness to each other. I am 5'10", thin to average build, brown hair and eyes. I am easy on the eyes and a good looking man for my age. There is a lot more but, what can you really say here? I am not perfect but I am a good guy worth getting to know.

So why am I posting here and what am I exactly looking for? Good question that I asked for you, lol. First, I actively date so I am not the "I am lonely so let me try CL". I read postings here occasionally and I have read some genuine ones from people that seem to be looking for what I am. Of course most are just BS but a few are real and they don't seem to be from serial daters like most dating websites are encourage. Maybe this will sound wrong but, I am very non vanilla sexually and CL people seem to be more of the non vanilla types. Hey, if you're a woman and post here you must be somewhat adventurous, just my thought, perhaps I am wrong. I am more about personality than looks but I do have my preferences which are ladies that are thin to a little extra padding, someone that is not a 50 miles away from me, she is all about sharing and enjoying life and is not tied down and able to actually go out and have fun. 

I will of course send my picture if I like your reply to my post but, I expect one in return as I won't meet with anyone that can't send me a picture, would you? I prefer your picture on the first reply but I do understand reasons people have for waiting a bit. Please be between 40ish to 50ish, stable mentally and financially. 

Looking forward to your reply!

title: Taking a chance here
text:
So I'm not putting much hope into this, as it is CL after all, but 

So what I offer:
A stable, committed, long-term relationship and/or marriage. Integrity is important to me. Once I commit, whether it is to a relationship or something else, I will do everything I can to honor that commitment. I'm honest, sometimes to a fault, but I believe that honesty is always the best policy, because lies will be found out eventually, then you're dealing with a double whammy of issues. Not worth it. I believe I am compassionate and kind. I believe in communication and that involves as much listening (if not more) as talking. I am successful, make a 6+ figure income, have a strong net worth and credit rating. I own my home, have a nice car, travel often. I'm physically fit, although I don't spend my life in a gym, I'd prefer to be out living it. I do spend 6-8 hours a week exercising, 2-4 times a week. I'm considered good looking. I'm healthy, rarely do I get sick, and believe in a healthy lifestyle. I do not smoke or do drugs. I drink, but almost never by myself, so I would consider that a social drinker, and I rarely drink to excess. I have minimal baggage from past relationships, and no ex-drama in my life. I travel internationally for both work and pleasure and can legally buy and own guns (read into that, that I'm not an ex-con and there are no domestic violence issues).

So I'm on here because I want to start a conversation with someone in the hopes that it could lead to a relationship. I'm recently back on the market after ending a long term relationship and am finding that women are so guarded and cautious that it is hard to get past those walls and start a friendship, let alone a relationship. I'm hoping that by using an "anonymous" service like this, that we can actually talk openly, since it is easy to disappear if it doesn't sound like we're compatible. 

But then again, this is Craigslist, where everybody's inner freak comes out. But, a little freak is good. We all have it, and hopefully I'll find someone who's inner freak can work with mine.

So I don't really have an "ideal" match in mind. I'm more interested if there is compatibility in our personalities and interests. But I'll offer some idea, 35-40, but a little older or younger are probably fine. 20's or younger and 50's or older are probably too far apart. I'd probably prefer someone shorter than me, who is in similar physical shape/condition, but I'm not looking for a model or diva. Been there, done that, and want someone real, not someone chasing an unrealistic expectation of perpetual youth. As to weight, I'm a fairly physically active person, and want someone who can keep up. Drugs or smoking is mostly a deal breaker for me, even e-cigs. Drinking isn't an issue as long as it is reasonable and responsible. Ethnicity isn't important, as long as there are cultural compatibilities.

I would like to find someone who isn't jaded from past experiences. I've always tried to remind myself that every relationship will fail until you find the one that doesn't. I'd like to find someone who understands that. With a relationship, the subject of sex comes up. Yes, I want to talk about compatibility there, but I'm more interested in finding someone who wants to go out and enjoy life. I'm not here for a hook up, fwb, or the like. I'd like to find someone who wants to go to fairs and festivals, museums, concerts, shows. Someone who wants to get out and see the world. 

Anyway, here's to finding someone compatible. Good luck to you as well!

title: Seeking young woman for committed relationship
text:
One thing that seems to get lost in today's world is that it takes a while to build-up experience and serious earning power. This has always been the case for hundreds of years. I've spent years focused on my career and have finally gotten to the point where I am comfortable (maybe they were misguided, but I can't change the past). First and foremost, I want to share my life with someone who is interested in living comfortably, not one where everything is a dramatic stress and money is a constant problem or worry. My life is pretty balanced and I got there by not blowing everything just to have designer clothes or other unimportant things; what you wear today won't matter in five years (or less). I'm not cheap, but I am efficient and aware that the highest-priced item is not always the best.

I enjoy doing all kinds of things but I have no one to share doing these things with. I love to travel, try out new restaurants (especially patios this time of year), cooking, sports games, live music, fast cars, nerdy stuff like computers, video games and all kinds of books appeal to me. Sure, I'm single, but I'm not lonely or desperate. The whole point of my post is to appeal to someone who "gets" what I'm looking for and is genuine enough to not want to change themselves or someone else. I've never understood why women will enter in to relationships hoping that the guy will change... Only to find out years and several kids later that he won't.

What am I looking for beyond this? Well, you should be at least 18 and no older than 30 - I want to have children with a woman who is healthy enough and also wants to have children. Sure, celebrities are out there having kids at 50, but they're celebrities and millions of dollars will buy you anything, including surrogates. I'm slim so I expect someone who is also slim or curvy, but not fat. I'm not fat or unattractive (or both) so please keep that in mind. 

I'm a well put-together and great guy (by many accounts). I've been proposed to a few times, I've had a serious relationship before but things didn't work out (she didn't want children after all) - I'll get along with almost anyone, I like most pets, can fix cars, paint walls, etc... I can do almost anything but the biggest problem I've run in to is that I am either too much for some people to deal with, or we just don't get along. But I've been pretty clear about what I'm looking for so it should make it easy for whoever is interested :)
