title: SWM, professional, attractive, stable seeks similar
text:
I'm giving this a try because a friend of mine suggested it, although others have stated it's mostly for hookups and people who can't really get dates (which sounds awful). But I'm a busy professional, hoping that someone will understand that some people work too hard and then wake-up one day and realize... I hate waking up alone (I may be alone, but I am not lonely, just sayin'). I'm not posting a picture because I think almost everyone comes here to look through pictures and skip over the details (which supports the hookup thing). But this is the LTR section so maybe some women looking through here are more focused on important personality traits, are trying to get past the "bad boy" stage (or are already past it) and are looking for quality in all areas... and not just looks. I'm not unattractive, but I am more concerned about what co-workers would think of me posting on here. 

I am, by most measures, a great guy. I haven't had an easy life and this has made me work harder and allowed me to focus on what it takes to be successful. But I need to focus on what I am looking for in a partner, and yes, I believe that relationships are partnerships (I will not be your slave nor do I expect you to be one). I am respectful of women thanks to my feminist mother (more of the old-school feminists, not the kind who take offense to anything-negative-about-women ones of today). I like to think that I have morals and ethics but I'm not religious. I'm very much a logical person, more introverted but not completely unemotional and definitely not a shy or quiet person... Reserved is a better word for things (people tend to not really know what logical and introverted mean). I've traveled a lot, I'm well read, intelligent, funny, sociable, know how to match colors, cook, clean, etc... but I've just spent a lot of time focused on my career and not finding a woman who is a good fit for me. No doubt relocating for my career and losing the social circle of friends when doing so, not being religious and combined with a personal rule of no dating in the work place, and you can see why I'm here. 

I work out several times a week, I enjoy going out to dinner and trying new food (and new things in general), traveling, occasionally reading, video games, and even going to Ikea. I'm passionate about technology and cars and like to learn how things work - I've been told that I am always thinking, but I know when to shut down and go to sleep :) I have some close friends, I'm not one of those narcissistic Facebook fiends who claims to have hundreds of "friends," I like pets (cats and dogs) and I am generally just very personable and calming. I'm detailed and articulate and I remember all manner of things (like birthdays, anniversaries and other important things - ask me about my family's birthdays because I know them all, ha!). I'm a typical first-born child, so I am responsible and usually punctual and perhaps a bit OCD about things. 

I've been proposed to a few times so this should answer any of those questions (or possibly remove doubts) you may have had about why I seem impossibly normal (or hopefully better than just normal). A lot of people seem to want to get married out of desperation or pressure. I'm not desperate or trying to escape a bad situation (which is what the women who proposed to me were looking for, and I can see a bad deal from a long-distance). By many accounts I am a catch but I try to stay modest about it. I just haven't found the right fit for me and dating is such a disaster when you don't believe in playing silly games or being deceitful or lying to get people to like you. I'm honest and that's how it should be. 

So what am I looking for? Well, I think based on everything above, you should have a good idea by now if I might get along with you (and vis-a-versa). I'll qualify things by saying that I am looking for someone who is physically attractive; I've been consistently rated as an 8 and probably slip to a 7 on a stressful/tiring day so please keep this in mind. An attractive personality is even more important as looks fade as time goes on; if we can't talk about different things, openly, and keep things light-hearted but serious when it's necessary, then we're on different pages. I'll be passionate and appreciative and I'm very considerate about many things. But I'm still human and I realize that working on my "less desirable" traits is part of being an adult. If you're mature, reasonable, not completely ignorant, are generally calm and cool and comfortable with who you are, then I think we should start talking with each other and see where things go. Ideally I'd like to have some children so I am looking for someone who is between the ages of 18 and 32. Ethnicity I am pretty open on because skin color (and age) doesn't determine who someone is, but background and personality do.

title: I want to be part of your pregnancy
text:
If you're going through your pregnancy alone but wish you had someone there to be supportive and excited about it with you, please read on.

I think pregnant woman are breathtakingly beautiful, and the process of pregnancy itself fascinates me. As a guy who plans never to have children of his own, I'm an outsider looking in, wishing I could be part of the journey with someone. I want to watch you grow, feel your baby kick, be there through the good times and the bad, and even go to ultrasounds and checkups with you, if you'd like me to accompany you.

Here's how I see it: if your baby's father isn't there for you and you want someone to fill that void, you've GOT to email me. We can help each other out. You set all the rules and boundaries, so everything is about what you're comfortable with (do we see each other once a week? less? more? do we date? do we sleep together? do i come to your checkups? do you have me there for the birth? etc.)

I have been trying to make this happen for over a year now, and I can't tell you how many times I've been ghosted after things are looking great... so please only get my hopes up if you're serious about meeting and letting me be a part of your pregnancy.

When you email, I'd appreciate it if you'd make the subject be how many months pregnant you are, as that helps me know you're not a bot.

Thanks for reading.

title: Even something you do for yourself should be appreciated by another
text:
One of your unkind voices told you that you couldn't do it. Whether the time was measured in days, months or years, you spent too much of it worried that you wouldn't enjoy the process of change. However you felt about your body, you thought that it might not be accepted. You feared that you would be judged harshly. Maybe you felt that other challenges were more "appropriate" for you, or that you'd be surrounded by people whose experiences you couldn't identify with.

There was a part of yourself that would have driven other women to physical violence, if only its destructive attention had focused on them. But that part seemed to live only to tell you what you didn't deserve.

But with courage, you quieted that part of yourself. With or without tears, you began to forgive yourself for ever listening to that loathsome echo. And you set about the joyful work of changing yourself, in countless increments, each with the weight of a single exhalation.

Now, an hour of intense activity or thoughtful asanas make you yearn for a few hours of abandon. And the resistance you face is so much lighter than the burden you cast off. But just because all of this has become a delight that give to yourself doesn't mean that someone else shouldn't appreciate it... without reservation, and without publication, in a way that graces your form. Because whatever your shape was yesterday, and whatever it will be tomorrow, today it knows that it can do, accept and love so much more.

Do you understand? Convince me.

title: looking for 35+ - no kegel exercises required
text:
i am wondering if there are any women, mom-types or maybe even never married gals out there with a little extra room where it counts (in the 'vag' area). i know the request sounds more than a little unusual, but am interested in getting to know that unique and special woman who must be out there and (for whatever reason) just isn't super 'tight'; one who enjoys her alone time with that special secret x-large 'hardware' in the nightstand drawer.

i hear and read so much about girls and the desire for *mr big* to come along - but really, how often does that actually happen in real life? is that life and love really much different than with a person (maybe slightly larger than 'average') with whom you could share this fun with? (and I mean as an addition to all the ordinary bedroom activities). again i know this sounds highly unusual, but everyone is different, as well as 'built' differently; i know from experience are a lot of girls to whom this might apply, whether they keep this to themselves, or even admit it to themselves for that matter. 
i have not dated very much post-divorce and of the very few gals i even have ended up in bed with, all but one was so tight - it just was not comfortable or fun for me. also, they generally needed to stop far too soon for my liking. i'm not saying that my 'stuff' is so much larger than normal, or that tight is such a bad thing - just that i think large p*ssys are beautiful and as just as much fun to play with. i'd like to meet someone who maybe thinks nobody will appreciate that about her, and prove this wrong. and yes i've heard that before (many times) and know as a man, that it's much more common than most people think.

age isn't all that important - i would prefer late 30s to mid 50s. body shape isn't either, though i would under size 14 to 16 would be a better fit for me. i am late 40s, caucasian, tall, semi-athletic, hwp, clever, kind, polite, clean, funny, ddf and i will be as discreet and direct about this as you want.

i am a normal person just like you, and in the long run i am not looking for just fwb or sex. i did not ask for, nor wish for my marriage to end and i honestly do not enjoy the 'single life' and being alone. i try my best to be a good person and i like to do all kinds of things when time permits, so long as the mundanity of activity doesn't bore me to death lol. if everything works out to be mutual fun for both of us, there is literally no end to all we can do, for how long it can continue, or even how far it can go. if it doesn't last, then at least can say we had some caring, decent grown up fun in the meantime. and trust me, i can keep up the stated 'activities' pretty much regularly and indefinitely with the right woman who wants this in her life. i have nobody to answer to and no ties to any other woman anymore. i'm only interested in having 'one' and would be most interested in someone else who was as well.

i am personally tired of spending valuable time sorting through the 'party people' losers and perpetual daters - it's always a massive let-down when the realization hits that you've only become involved with another one. it gets real old, REAL fast; i thought it'd just be better to say exactly what i'm looking for. i don't know about you, but it bugs me to be alone (and going *without*), while at the same time sitting by and watching others have all the fun they want.

so, if you were interested enough to read this far, thank you. i hope you will answer, especially if you think this sounds like something you can relate to and that which you may desire. my request is to just be nice in doing so please. i have composed this as informational, honestly and respectfully as possible - like it says, we are ALL different and this ad is not intended to offend anyone. if this isn't 'you' or for you, i'm sure there are plenty of other ads on cl for you to look at. if you do agree - *even* in part - i would like to hear from you about it. i don't think i know nor can i think of everything, so feel free to ask and/or elaborate. if you do wish to respond, please do so with something informative, if possible; i can get 'nice ad' or 'what's up' from the girl at the 7/11. pics would nice too, especially if you are planning on asking for mine. i promise if you take the time to write me, i will write you back asap.

this ad is 100% real and on the level. thanks for reading and good luck in your search.

 UPDATE: due to some recent, very clever email scams and phishes, i am no longer answering generic, cut/paste type anythings like "i like your ad", "you sound nice" etc.. my ad is very specific and if you really read the thing and are genuinely interested enough to think that it sounds like you and what you want, please write something that is relative to the context to let me know you understand and are (real and) interested. thanks.

title: Let's start out as online friends.
text:
If you just want to skim, read the parts inside **double asterisks**.


WHAT I'M LOOKING FOR

**Eventually, a romantic and sexual long-term relationship.** I want someone who I can share my deepest feelings with, and who I can bond with physically through cuddling, sex, and kissing. When I say 'romantic', I don't mean roses and chocolates, I mean in the sense that some people are aromantic.

**Someone willing to talk online while I get comfortable around them.** I'm really, really shy, and I'd like to get to know you online first, so I can feel more comfortable around you and decide if we're a good match. This might take a really long time, while I gradually get used to talking to you.

**Someone within driving distance.** This is a pretty flexible criterion, but I just don't want to be stuck in a long-distance relationship. One of the big reasons I'm looking for someone is for physical intimacy. Not just sex, but also cuddling, hugging, kissing, etc.

**Someone over the age of consent.** This one's pretty self-explanatory.

**Someone who I can have interesting conversations with.** I hate to say this sort of thing, but a lot of topics just aren't all that interesting to me. I like to talk about really technical stuff like cellular automata, computer programming, and what an AI might be like. If that sort of thing isn't for you, I'm also interested in just sharing and talking about interesting ideas. Stuff like TED talks or weird mathematical proofs. Or even just comparing our personalities and life experiences.


WHAT I DON'T CARE ABOUT, OR DON'T MIND

**Appearance.** I want someone who I find mentally attractive. Not (necessarily) physically.

**If you're older.** There are a lot of societal values that I think are silly, and this is one of those. At the moment, I can't think of any reason why I /shouldn't/ date older women, so I'm happy to do just that.


ABOUT ME

**INTP.** Yeah, the MBTI is deprecated. But it's what everyone's familiar with.

**Kind of a geek.** Well, actually that's an understatement. I like anime, Let's Plays, video games, D&D, computer programming, scifi, etc.

**Social anxiety, big time.** I'm extremely shy, even online. Talking to people is really scary to me, and responding to messages takes a lot of courage, so don't be surprised if I take a long time to respond. Because of that, it's generally better to send longer messages, since it's just as easy for me to reply to a long message than a short one, and with a long message I have more to reply /to/, if that makes sense. Also, I might stop replying altogether, but that's not because I don't like you or you said the wrong thing. It's just because I got a little too stressed and had to stop.

title: What a real love connection is to me:
text:
A woman that not only means the world to me, but she feels the same about me. When she smiles at me, it touches my heart, and I love her a little more each time. When she sits next to me in the car, it makes me feel like when I am on my first date. When I kiss her, she kisses back, because it means as much to her. She doesn't just receive the kiss, she's kissing me back. You may have to think about that comment. If you don't have to think about it, you're one of the fortunate that know what I mean. 

When we lay down together, she amazes me, just because of the fact it is me she lays with. I never take that for granted, it means so very much to me to be with her. When she gives herself to me, she makes me feel it through my whole body. More importantly, I feel it inside. It's more than body to body, for our bodies are a shell of our existence. In order to reach the heart and soul, your very being that gives you breath and life, you have to love very deeply. 

If you like what I feel I need, and it matters to you also, why not contact me. See if maybe I can be that man you are searching for in your life. If I'm not that man, what have you got to lose? Isn't it that important to you to find out? It certainly is to me. I'm waiting on you, I know you are out there, somewhere. The fact you are reading this, and have read it all to here, may be a sign to you. What if you ignore that sign? Will you regret it later in life? Life is short, don't risk wasting it.

title: It's really hard to rise above the rest of the creeps
text:
Dating is hard. Trying to push yourself to meet a young lady is difficult because in the world of online dating, you have a bunch of creepy men flaunting their chops at a multitude of women overwhelmed by their number of prospects all the while being discouraged and frustrated at the continuous growth male mental midgetry. I have come to lean on online dating, whether it concerns craigslist or an online dating site. That said, I've decided to swing for the fences. How can I stand out from the rest of the creeps? I feel as though I have a lot to offer, but getting someone to give you a chance is a large hump to get over. Send someone a message. Who knows if she will even read it? Not a simple "hi" or "You're hot" but legitimate well thought out message that might make her do a double take. 

Love is a semi-myth. It seems like becoming a billionaire would take less time and less sweat. I have loved two women in my life, and it took two years to determine that's how I felt. So what am I doing here hoping for something that can grow from simple roots to one of those Northern California Redwoods, rising so high above the rest of the pedestrian foliage? I would just make this offer: let's talk and be friends. If there is compatibility, you know perfectly well it comes naturally, and if it does come, perhaps we are greeted by a feeling of affirmation that is strong and satisfying that is simply cannot spoken or written.

Still trying to rise above the creeps...

Well I got the last laugh, because she was actually an anorexic chick living in her dad's attic. Nothing like the sweet taste of winning an argument. . 

Let's be real for a minute though... Being a writer in a cyber-dating environment is like being a whole wheat bagel in the middle of a donut shop. You might be the only thing with substance, but your chances of getting purchased are right up there with the chances of a one-legged fat kid winning the Dayton 500 on a bicycle. 

I even tried one of those "chat lines" you see on TV late at night if you are watching any type of programming that caters to anything with a penis. I figured "what's the worst that could happen?", much like I do in 98% of the decisions I make, and dialed away. My luck, I got a girl that stuttered. Worst 342 dollars I've ever spent. The Kama Sutra was created in the Middle East so you can imagine what went on there. . .yeah, she walked me through how to fix my computer.

I guess before this ad reached some unknown word limit, or you decide to wander off and look at wang pictures - I'll give you a little insight to the man behind the beard:
1. As I mentioned, I have an incredible beard. It makes at least ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â‚ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â¾ of my decisions on a daily basis, and houses almost all of my mojo. How Important is a beard? Chuck Norris? Beard. Gandalf? Beard. Jesus? I've made my point.

3. I was once arrested for hitting a man in the face with my Mackerel. He had to get stitches.
4. "Mackerel" is not a euphemism for "penis", but "golf cart" can be.
5. I've done more dangerous things on a golf cart than the average man has done in his life. Shit, I shouldn't have mentioned "golf cart as a penis euphemism" thing in the last one huh? Now it sounds like I do dangerous things on penises, which I do not. . .

8. I've made more than one person laugh so hard they peed on themselves. This week. 
9. My homemade sausage based Italian meat sauce has won battles. Mostly online battles, between myself and 14 year olds while playing Call of Duty, but still. . .
10. When I make a milkshake, all the boys come to my yard. And they are always like, "it's better than yours". And then I ask "who's? who the hell are you talking about. . .why are you in my yard?", and they are like "can you teach us?" and I'm like, "yeah, but there is a price. . .."

title: I would like to be your Sugar Daddy.
text:
Edited***


I have gotten a ton of emails and feel that I need to clarify what are deal breakers:


One: If you live out of state. I'm not going to fly someone in on weekends to see me. Or drive to the other side of the DFW metroplex to see you. Sorry, living an hour away from me won't work out well for either of us.

Two: If you are not single. Having a girlfriend, boyfriend, husband will not work for me. And do not try to lie and say you're single but have a picture posted of you and your boyfriend on your Facebook page. Please have all your affairs in order (pardon the pun).

Three: Having an STD. (It's sad I even have to mention this, but...this is Craigslist.)

Four: Not having the time to devote to an actual relationship. If you work 36hrs a week and go to college and have a kid, I commend you for that, I truly do, but you won't have time for me. Seeing me once a week or every other weekend is not what I have in mind.


Five: You use drugs at all, or abuse alcohol. Sorry, I don't want to deal with any potential drama.


Now....on with my ad!


Greetings!

I know what your first question will be "If you're looking for a SB/SD relationship, why are you posting in Casual Encounters? Well, I thought that my ad wouldn't get flagged if I posted here (it still may, who knows?).

Lets start with what I am looking for: A DDF, smart, single, funny, witty, sexy lady with minimal tat's and drama in her life that almost always has a positive attitude and loves to travel. I want her to be HWP or curvy. I am flexible on age and ethnicity. Please, no heavy drinkers or drug users at all. And yes, I consider 420 a drug. I'm not judging you, I just don't want it around me. Thanks.

Who I am: A 39yr old, Single, DDF, White, College educated guy who lives alone. Has never been married (but I came very close once), and have no kids or pets. I do not drink or do drugs at all, but I do smoke cigarettes. I am officially retired from my field of work because I was blessed with a very generous inheritance last year. I won't say how much, but I draw mid six figures just from the interest alone! 

So I bought a sizable piece of land and built my dream home (it's not a huge house either, it's juuuuuuuust right for me). After living here for awhile I realized something "God it sucks being single and sleeping alone!"

What I am willing to offer: Obviously I can help you out financially (which will vary from person to person). Dinners, Shows, Shopping, Traveling (I love to travel, and so should you. Please have a passport). I can pay your monthly/weekly expenses plus take you on a few trips or go shopping, or just give you a weekly/monthly allowance, whatever we both agree to.

I would like a sugar baby who I could see a few times a week and occasionally have her stay the night or late. Again, that is malleable and can be discussed between the lady I choose. I only want one sugar baby and expect to be your only Bf/SD/Etc... 

If you're made it this far, great! Please feel free to email me and tell me about yourself, and feel free to send a picture. (Anyone who emails me simply with "pic?", or anything of the like, will be deleted automatically). Why would you like to be considered? What is your ideal SB/SD situation?

Also change the title of your email to something original. It will let me know that you actually took the time to read the entire posting.

P.S. The picture obviously isn't me, I just thought it was kind of funny.

title: It's really hard to rise above the rest of the creeps
text:
Dating is hard. Trying to push yourself to meet a young lady is difficult because in the world of online dating, you have a bunch of creepy men flaunting their chops at a multitude of women overwhelmed by their number of prospects all the while being discouraged and frustrated at the continuous growth male mental midgetry. I have come to lean on online dating, whether it concerns craigslist or an online dating site. That said, I've decided to swing for the fences. How can I stand out from the rest of the creeps? I feel as though I have a lot to offer, but getting someone to give you a chance is a large hump to get over. Send someone a message. Who knows if she will even read it? Not a simple "hi" or "You're hot" but legitimate well thought out message that might make her do a double take. 

Love is a semi-myth. It seems like becoming a billionaire would take less time and less sweat. I have loved two women in my life, and it took two years to determine that's how I felt. So what am I doing here hoping for something that can grow from simple roots to one of those Northern California Redwoods, rising so high above the rest of the pedestrian foliage? I would just make this offer: let's talk and be friends. If there is compatibility, you know perfectly well it comes naturally, and if it does come, perhaps we are greeted by a feeling of affirmation that is strong and satisfying that is simply cannot spoken or written.

Still trying to rise above the creeps...

Anyway, not only am I "that dude," but in all likelihood I'm going to come out of this smelling like a rose. I filed a lawsuit a few months after all this happened. So to sum all this up, I have a temporary Life sentence for standing up for my rights. This'll be overturned within the next year or two. And I have a rock solid lawsuit. title: It's really hard to rise above the rest of the creeps
text:
Dating is hard. Trying to push yourself to meet a young lady is difficult because in the world of online dating, you have a bunch of creepy men flaunting their chops at a multitude of women overwhelmed by their number of prospects all the while being discouraged and frustrated at the continuous growth male mental midgetry. I have come to lean on online dating, whether it concerns craigslist or an online dating site. That said, I've decided to swing for the fences. How can I stand out from the rest of the creeps? I feel as though I have a lot to offer, but getting someone to give you a chance is a large hump to get over. Send someone a message. Who knows if she will even read it? Not a simple "hi" or "You're hot" but legitimate well thought out message that might make her do a double take. Love is a semi-myth. It seems like becoming a billionaire would take less time and less sweat. I have loved two women in my life, and it took two years to determine that's how I felt. So what am I doing here hoping for something that can grow from simple roots to one of those Northern California Redwoods, rising so high above the rest of the pedestrian foliage? I would just make this offer: let's talk and be friends. If there is compatibility, you know perfectly well it comes naturally, and if it does come, perhaps we are greeted by a feeling of affirmation that is strong and satisfying that is simply cannot spoken or written.

Still trying to rise above the creeps...

title: A friend that's a girl
text: Well, there's nothing original about that. There are times when I feel like I conform to the typical craigslist creep, because to be honest, there's no normality to me in more ways than one. I'm a bit obsessive over things such as working out and sex. One of those things I do everyday, and there's another I'm hardly getting. It's a harsh and uncomfortable reality that I'm not sure I could just meet somebody for sex, so I guess I'll need to make a friend and see of there's any chemistry. If there is that necessary compatibility, after we have met for coffee or tea or walk in the park or after weeks of flakey texting and the occasional chat on the phone, maybe I can kiss you or hold you or something else? It's not an ad for sex. It's an ad for something that can lead to passion and deep love, physically and emotionally.

title: Something meaningful and passionate.
text:
Even though you are supposed to be happy with yourself before you can be happy with someone else, companionship is something I for one need and want, as does just about everyone else in the world. The question of compatibility and chemistry arise, of course. I'm looking for that compatible friend with the elements on the table that can complicate the ones I have. You only know if there's a match if we talk and spend a little time together. We cannot go into a laboratory and conduct experiments. My ideal woman would be between 18 and 40 with a love for cuddling, deep intimacy in an emotional and physical sense, a desire to see the world and take road trips and someone who loves animals. 

Healthy companionship shortens the distance from my outstretched arm to the realm of happiness.

title: Looking for an online friend who might become something more.
text:
I'm 21 years old, and I'm ideally looking for someone between 18 and 30, but I'm also open-minded about older women. I'm looking for someone to open up to, basically. I want to share thoughts and dreams and interests, maybe even theories and speculations about the future. If we click and seem to get along really well, things might progress from there. We could be IRL friends, or even have a romantic relationship. You can skip everything else in this post if you want, because this paragraph works as a pretty good summary.

So a little about my personality. I'm extremely smart, but also extremely introverted and shy. I can be really quirky, and I also have a darker side at times. Wow, it's really hard to summarize a personality in any meaningful way. Those two sentences were really just semantic white noise, huh? Well I guess I might as well keep going. I love solving puzzles and strategizing. Computer science is a huge passion of mine, but really any mystery or interesting branch of science or just anything complex and technical is the kind of thing I'll spend hours experimenting with.

title: Looking for an online friend who might become something more.
text:
I'm 21 years old, and I'm ideally looking for someone between 18 and 30, but I'm also open-minded about older women. I'm looking for someone to open up to, basically. I want to share thoughts and dreams and interests, maybe even theories and speculations about the future. If we click and seem to get along really well, things might progress from there. We could be IRL friends, or even have a romantic relationship. You can skip everything else in this post if you want, because this paragraph works as a pretty good summary.

So a little about my personality. I'm extremely smart, but also extremely introverted and shy. I can be really quirky, and I also have a darker side at times. Wow, it's really hard to summarize a personality in any meaningful way. Those two sentences were really just semantic white noise, huh? Well I guess I might as well keep going. I love solving puzzles and strategizing. Computer science is a huge passion of mine, but really any mystery or interesting branch of science or just anything complex and technical is the kind of thing I'll spend hours experimenting with.

Unfortunately, I'm really really shy. I have what could be brutally yet accurately described as "crippling social anxiety". I'm afraid of talking to people, and of being judged by people, and yet at the same time I'm really getting lonely. So that's why I want to talk to someone online. Talking to people online is still a little scary for me, but it's not nearly as bad. Especially if it's with long messages, maybe around the length of this post here, over a long period of time.

I could write a concluding paragraph here, but honestly I never understood the point of those. They're just a rephrasing of the introductory paragraph, aren't they? But I should definitely write /something/ in this last paragraph or this post will seem to have ended suddenly, and with no real conclusion. Just sorta meandering around until it abruptly and arbitrarily stops.

I'm a musician. I'm an atheist who wishes he had never sinned against God. A man who once sat for two days in order to determine why women are most beautiful in the morning, but failed to realize that his lover had gone away from him. Upon realizing that she had gone I lost my answer. I once walked 40 miles to determine if I could. I slept for a week in a bathroom that was on the beach, but every day I dressed in a suit, was clean shaven, and ate in hotels I couldn't afford to stay in. I was born into a family that was too poor to afford anything more than the can of beans in the pantry. If possible I would choose to go to school every day for the rest of my life. title: Can Your Heart Love Mine?
text:
Artistic freedom, and the pursuit of happiness. Abstract life is best lived in the now. Not delayed and not always planed out. Taking the path that often chose us, instead of us seeking out the path to take. Order is important, and without it there is chaos, and wasteful progress. Without meaning the heart is just a muscle that insures the flow of blood. Such as life, without meaning you can not flow through life. Rather you sink into the abyss of darkness. What I am seeking is that one person that understands my heart, finds my mind obtrusively intriguing. A person that will foster my creativeness and humble my exuberant triumphs. Where can one find such an individual that fits into a specially crafted box, yet has the power to break free from conformity? For all the dreams in the world, and the universe as our canvas. Will walk, paint, sculpt and capture all there is too in our life side by side with me?

Tiresome searching for the woman that understands me, and is willing to get to know me. It seems to me that no matter how I explain who I am, what I am and who I seek. I get the ones that are far from what I seek, and cant stand who I am. Lacking the fact they failed to listen to my description of my self. All I want is a woman that takes care of herself, someone strong compassionate and patient. Understanding that sometimes the man on top of being a horny bastard, can be a handful. While being respectful and loving. 

I am 37 single as if that should already be understood. I have blue eyes, brown hair a full beard I am very much attached to. At 5'10" I am slightly over weight at 245lbs. But after all I am not as active as I could be. 

Photography is my passion and my therapy. Currently I am working on building my vision that revolves around it. I have been on SSDI for the past 6 or so years. Too many years of very hard work and life caught up to me. As well I have not driven in years, and currently do not. 

Not sure what else to say, other than I want forever with one woman. I am very open to moving fast if we get along. As well I refuse to play games, nor do I want a long drama filled experience.

You can only find what your looking for, when you open your eyes. For some love is nothing more than an idea in which they romanticize. Never actually knowing love. For me I am seeking a woman that wants a true emotional passion filled love. One that deepens over time, and allows you to overcome anything. I am so tired of saying I do not play games, and then someone wants to play games. If I tell you I love you. It is because I do. I have a grand vision for myself, and I know it may take most my life to achieve. I'd love to have a woman that enjoys the same things I do. To join me both in my creative dreams as well as in my pursuit of love. I am a very sexual person. But I must feel a deep connection before I can actually enjoy it. I believe in love as being between two people, and only two people. I hate to communicate, as it leads to frustration. However I do my best to both listen to my partner and express how I feel. I would love to say when we connect, we will be together all the time. Reality is we both have our own lives, and sometimes no matter how much we get along and love each other we need our own space. Just be open with me, and I will be open with you. I can fall fast if the situation is right, as well I can be very intense. So if any of this makes sense or appeals to you. Come and lets build a life together.


p.s.
I have Zero interest in instant or future family. I am seeking a Childless relationship.

title: Where Are the Single Moms?
text:
Are there any single Mom's out there that want to make a new friend?

No, it's not a fetish thing. And no, I don't want to be the new Daddy to your kids...

I just find that single Mom's know what's up, you know? They are strong, they don't take any bullshit from people, they have their priorities straight, and they are usually very confident and independent. I like dealing with someone who just says what's on their mind because they don't have time for games, someone who knows what it means to sacrifice and can enjoy what they have when they have it instead of always chasing the next dream or wasting their life.

I'm not saying you shouldn't have aspirations for greatness. But I am far more attracted to someone who is grounded in reality that some starry eyed person with no life experience outside of college. Someone who has their act together, and isn't looking for a hand out, or drug money. 

It also helps to know going into it that the other person in the equation gets what it means to have kids as part of the deal, and won't bust your chops if you cancel plans because you didn't know that have a project due, or you have to take them somewhere, or because you are just worn the f%&^{ out from dealing with them after a long day at work too.

title: It's really hard to rise above the rest of the creeps
text:
Dating is hard. Trying to push yourself to meet a young lady is difficult because in the world of online dating, you have a bunch of creepy men flaunting their chops at a multitude of women overwhelmed by their number of prospects all the while being discouraged and frustrated at the continuous growth male mental midgetry. I have come to lean on online dating, whether it concerns craigslist or an online dating site. That said, I've decided to swing for the fences. How can I stand out from the rest of the creeps? I feel as though I have a lot to offer, but getting someone to give you a chance is a large hump to get over. Send someone a message. Who knows if she will even read it? Not a simple "hi" or "You're hot" but legitimate well thought out message that might make her do a double take. 

Love is a semi-myth. It seems like becoming a billionaire would take less time and less sweat. I have loved two women in my life, and it took two years to determine that's how I felt. So what am I doing here hoping for something that can grow from simple roots to one of those Northern California Redwoods, rising so high above the rest of the pedestrian foliage? I would just make this offer: let's talk and be friends. If there is compatibility, you know perfectly well it comes naturally, and if it does come, perhaps we are greeted by a feeling of affirmation that is strong and satisfying that is simply cannot spoken or written.

Still trying to rise above the creeps...

title: It's really hard to rise above the rest of the creeps
text:
Dating is hard. Trying to push yourself to meet a young lady is difficult because in the world of online dating, you have a bunch of creepy men flaunting their chops at a multitude of women overwhelmed by their number of prospects all the while being discouraged and frustrated at the continuous growth male mental midgetry. I have come to lean on online dating, whether it concerns craigslist or an online dating site. That said, I've decided to swing for the fences. How can I stand out from the rest of the creeps? I feel as though I have a lot to offer, but getting someone to give you a chance is a large hump to get over. Send someone a message. Who knows if she will even read it? Not a simple "hi" or "You're hot" but legitimate well thought out message that might make her do a double take. Love is a semi-myth. It seems like becoming a billionaire would take less time and less sweat. I have loved two women in my life, and it took two years to determine that's how I felt. So what am I doing here hoping for something that can grow from simple roots to one of those Northern California Redwoods, rising so high above the rest of the pedestrian foliage? I would just make this offer: let's talk and be friends. If there is compatibility, you know perfectly well it comes naturally, and if it does come, perhaps we are greeted by a feeling of affirmation that is strong and satisfying that is simply cannot spoken or written.

Still trying to rise above the creeps...

title: Part-Time Exotic Dancer Seeks Pirate Side-Kick for Shennanigans
text:
Let's just address the items in the title first. I mean, it's that or the picture that got you to open this ad, so let's get that out of the way. 

First off, my exotic dancing career is on the skids. Back in the day, I was known as "The White Velvet Thunderclap", and was renowned across the lands as one of the top 5 exotic dancing/competitive lumberjack acts in the country. Unfortunately, as I have aged, and made increasing worse decisions regarding my agent, I'm now stuck on the retirement/nursing home circuit. If I get booked on another bingo night, I might just quit. Rappers like to make it "rain", but old bingo women make it "hail". On the bright Side: My ability to dodge a weakly thrown quarter is like a mongoose's ability to avoid a cobra strike, but there is nothing more shameful than dosing yourself with spray glue and rolling around on the ground to collect your night's earnings. *wipes tear* The thing that really hurts about the situation is that I think I've still got the juice to be one of the top dancer/competitive lumberjacks one the scene. I mean, just the other morning while still slightly intoxicated from a long night of drinking and watching youtube videos, I danced so hard to a Maroon 5 song in a 7-11 that I got a free slice of pizza. Those kinds of skills don't just fall off of the male exotic dancer tree. 

Now as far as what I am looking for, I need women to know that my Pirate status is totally legit. I'm not talking about a passing interest in a baseball team from Pittsburgh, I'm talking real pirate shit. The last time I threw a "pirate party", my costume was so authentic that I hijacked a passenger ship, and used it to rob a merchant vessel. The fact that the "passenger ship" strongly resembled a short bus full of handicapped children, and the "merchant vessel" happened to look like a food truck, have absolutely no bearing on the legitness of my pirate status. If I was any more pirate, I'd have won an Oscar for being in a movie with Tom Hanks. (Captain Phillips jokes? Anyone?)

So now that we've covered that, let's get to the point here. . .There was a point, right? Oh yeah, I am a 33-year-old, never-married, kid-less, professional writer/amateur comedian. I'm broadcasting myself to the internet because I spend a ton of time developing my career, and I honestly want to find an excuse to not work so damn much. Dating is stupid, and therefore, I don't do it. Not that writing personals ads is any smarter, I just know how to handle it. The internet is a scary place. . .That's why I wrote a book back in 2008 called "Bitches in Your Bushes: A Guide to Internet Dating". So when it comes to the internet, I'm as adept as Bear Grylls drinking his own pee. 

So let's assume you're not a creeper, and that hollowing out my body to make a canoe to float down a river in is not on your "to-do" list. Here's what I suggest: reply to this email with something more than "Hi, your funny", include a picture, and maybe you can be in the running to be my pirate sidekick. . .

title: Please date my human!
text:
My name's Mikala, but most of the time my friends call me "Hey you." I'm five years old, with brown eyes, and I'm yellow. Not exotic or anything just.... Labrador yellow. Anyway, this is not about me, this is about my Human Companion. 

He's really cute, about 6' 2'' with short brown hair and is in his late 30's. I forget his actual age because I get busy doing other stuff like laying in the same spot for hours on end or chasing squirrels around the back yard in the middle of the night. Anyway, I want to tell you about him because I think there are a lot of reasons you should date him: 

1.	My HC is totally not getting what she needs from guy friends alone. I mean, of course they are invaluable, but there are obvious areas where guy friends don't cut it, and HC's guy friends are, well, manly. They're, like, the sort who watch anything sports and guy movies and stuff - whatever- *eye roll*. But my HC is more the if-something-isn't-blowing-up-in-the-first-fifteen-minutes-I'm-getting-bored and knows-all-the-lines-from-80's and 90's movies-type. 

2.	My HC is totally non-judgmental. I know, you're like, "this is about you being yellow, isn't it?" What is it with you humans and that stuff? Look, it's important if you have a sucky personality, if you're forehead-slappingly crackbrained, or if you have rather unfortunate personal hygiene habits, but it's not important what color you are. Anyway, can you remember where I was before I started ranting? Ah, yes-HC is non-judgmental. See, I have this personal thing. Ok, I'll say it. . . I'm a little paunchy in places. But, HC is totally cool with it. In fact, he calls my fatty bits "ploopy," isn't that cute? To hear him talk about it, you'd think ploopy was the solution to the world's problems. I think this is evidence that HC is a highly-evolved life-form. 

3.	My HC used to have this girl around that I called "mom," really only because it seemed to make him happy, but really I know she wasn't my mom. Anyway, the chick didn't like cook meals with him, I mean, is that even legal? He needs chicks who are low-key and not looking for a long-term, let's talk about our feelings, kind of thing. 

4.	A girl's gotta' eat. I mean, if he tries to pass celery and peanut butter off as a meal one more time, I'm calling someone. I'm not kidding, people, my paw is this close- THIS CLOSE. It's not like she can't afford something better, I get high-quality stuff in my bowl, man. And he's not one of those super-lame, new-diet-every-week, afraid-to-eat guys, either; he's a healthy eater, maybe even too healthy, I mean, I've never seen the boy turn down a cookie or piece of bacon. 

5.	Because God is fair. I mean look, yes he got a little too comfortable in his last relationship - what you're perfect. I seem to recall such things are important to you female-types. Of course, me, I'm a virgin, something about "being a responsible pet owner," whatever that means. . .but I digress. 

6.	My HC is running out of cool hobbies to pick up and I seriously do not want this getting out of control. He already travels. He takes me for walks all the time, we watch a lot of college sports and movies. He likes listening to music, and doesn't get all pretentious about what is "cool" to like and just digs the scene. Occasionally I catch him singing in the shower. And..Oh..My...God. I almost pee'd myself the first time it happened. 

He has lots of awesome friends who he hangs out with, so it's not like he's moping around longing for a woman to "complete" him or something. Really what I'm saying here is that I'd like to nip this "solo" thing he has going in the bud, before it starts down the path to crazy-town. . . 'cause I hate cats, man, and he's allergic, so this is a pre-emptive attack type thing. . . I am stealthy like a ninja. . . I creep in under cover of darkness using super-spy skills. . . ok, off vector again. 

7.	Because honestly, man, I am doing you a favor here. HC is a cool guy who is doing perfectly fine without you in his life, but maybe you're cool too and just want to eat some meals and have some fun. He's a funny and cute guy, so you might even get lucky, who knows. If his history is any indication, once she decides he's ready, he'll be back off the market in a snap, so this is really the best time to act, you know, while he's not really thinking about it too seriously. 

So anyway, I look forward to meeting you. Don't tell him I told you all this stuff 'cause he doesn't know anything about you yet and it will make him a little self-conscious. If you seem non-skeezy in your email, I can unbury my favorite picture of him and send it to you. Oh, and if I try to lick your face (or sniff your ass) when you come over to meet my HC up, don't be offended, it's just my way of saying hello!

i am wondering if there are any women, mom-types or maybe even never married gals out there with a little extra room where it counts (in the 'vag' area). i know the request sounds more than a little unusual, but am interested in getting to know that unique and special woman who must be out there and (for whatever reason) just isn't super 'tight'; one who enjoys her alone time with that special secret x-large 'hardware' in the nightstand drawer.

i hear and read so much about girls and the desire for *mr big* to come along - but really, how often does that actually happen in real life? is that life and love really much different than with a person (maybe slightly larger than 'average') with whom you could share this fun with? (and I mean as an addition to all the ordinary bedroom activities). again i know this sounds highly unusual, but everyone is different, as well as 'built' differently; i know from experience are a lot of girls to whom this might apply, whether they keep this to themselves, or even admit it to themselves for that matter. 
i have not dated very much post-divorce and of the very few gals i even have ended up in bed with, all but one was so tight - it just was not comfortable or fun for me. also, they generally needed to stop far too soon for my liking. i'm not saying that my 'stuff' is so much larger than normal, or that tight is such a bad thing - just that i think large p*ssys are beautiful and as just as much fun to play with. i'd like to meet someone who maybe thinks nobody will appreciate that about her, and prove this wrong. and yes i've heard that before (many times) and know as a man, that it's much more common than most people think.

age isn't all that important - i would prefer late 30s to mid 50s. body shape isn't either, though i would under size 14 to 16 would be a better fit for me. i am late 40s, caucasian, tall, semi-athletic, hwp, clever, kind, polite, clean, funny, ddf and i will be as discreet and direct about this as you want.

i am a normal person just like you, and in the long run i am not looking for just fwb or sex. i did not ask for, nor wish for my marriage to end and i honestly do not enjoy the 'single life' and being alone. i try my best to be a good person and i like to do all kinds of things when time permits, so long as the mundanity of activity doesn't bore me to death lol. if everything works out to be mutual fun for both of us, there is literally no end to all we can do, for how long it can continue, or even how far it can go. if it doesn't last, then at least can say we had some caring, decent grown up fun in the meantime. and trust me, i can keep up the stated 'activities' pretty much regularly and indefinitely with the right woman who wants this in her life. i have nobody to answer to and no ties to any other woman anymore. i'm only interested in having 'one' and would be most interested in someone else who was as well.

i am personally tired of spending valuable time sorting through the 'party people' losers and perpetual daters - it's always a massive let-down when the realization hits that you've only become involved with another one. it gets real old, REAL fast; i thought it'd just be better to say exactly what i'm looking for. i don't know about you, but it bugs me to be alone (and going *without*), while at the same time sitting by and watching others have all the fun they want.

so, if you were interested enough to read this far, thank you. i hope you will answer, especially if you think this sounds like something you can relate to and that which you may desire. my request is to just be nice in doing so please. i have composed this as informational, honestly and respectfully as possible - like it says, we are ALL different and this ad is not intended to offend anyone. if this isn't 'you' or for you, i'm sure there are plenty of other ads on cl for you to look at. if you do agree - *even* in part - i would like to hear from you about it. i don't think i know nor can i think of everything, so feel free to ask and/or elaborate. if you do wish to respond, please do so with something informative, if possible; i can get 'nice ad' or 'what's up' from the girl at the 7/11. pics would nice too, especially if you are planning on asking for mine. i promise if you take the time to write me, i will write you back asap.

this ad is 100% real and on the level. thanks for reading and good luck in your search.

 UPDATE: due to some recent, very clever email scams and phishes, i am no longer answering generic, cut/paste type anythings like "i like your ad", "you sound nice" etc.. my ad is very specific and if you really read the thing and are genuinely interested enough to think that it sounds like you and what you want, please write something that is relative to the context to let me know you understand and are (real and) interested. thanks.

title: Let's start out as online friends.
text:
If you just want to skim, read the parts inside **double asterisks**.


WHAT I'M LOOKING FOR

**Eventually, a romantic and sexual long-term relationship.** I want someone who I can share my deepest feelings with, and who I can bond with physically through cuddling, sex, and kissing. When I say 'romantic', I don't mean roses and chocolates, I mean in the sense that some people are aromantic.

**Someone willing to talk online while I get comfortable around them.** I'm really, really shy, and I'd like to get to know you online first, so I can feel more comfortable around you and decide if we're a good match. This might take a really long time, while I gradually get used to talking to you.

**Someone within driving distance.** This is a pretty flexible criterion, but I just don't want to be stuck in a long-distance relationship. One of the big reasons I'm looking for someone is for physical intimacy. Not just sex, but also cuddling, hugging, kissing, etc.

**Someone over the age of consent.** This one's pretty self-explanatory.

**Someone who I can have interesting conversations with.** I hate to say this sort of thing, but a lot of topics just aren't all that interesting to me. I like to talk about really technical stuff like cellular automata, computer programming, and what an AI might be like. If that sort of thing isn't for you, I'm also interested in just sharing and talking about interesting ideas. Stuff like TED talks or weird mathematical proofs. Or even just comparing our personalities and life experiences.


WHAT I DON'T CARE ABOUT, OR DON'T MIND

**Appearance.** I want someone who I find mentally attractive. Not (necessarily) physically.

**If you're older.** There are a lot of societal values that I think are silly, and this is one of those. At the moment, I can't think of any reason why I /shouldn't/ date older women, so I'm happy to do just that.


ABOUT ME

**INTP.** Yeah, the MBTI is deprecated. But it's what everyone's familiar with.

**Kind of a geek.** Well, actually that's an understatement. I like anime, Let's Plays, video games, D&D, computer programming, scifi, etc.

**Social anxiety, big time.** I'm extremely shy, even online. Talking to people is really scary to me, and responding to messages takes a lot of courage, so don't be surprised if I take a long time to respond. Because of that, it's generally better to send longer messages, since it's just as easy for me to reply to a long message than a short one, and with a long message I have more to reply /to/, if that makes sense. Also, I might stop replying altogether, but that's not because I don't like you or you said the wrong thing. It's just because I got a little too stressed and had to stop.

**Sort of a gothy side.** I tend to wear lots of black and monochrome, I generally listen to dark or sad music, I like /some/ horror movies (but I'm really picky), and I'm a big fan of Lovecraftian horror.

**I'm an open book.** You can ask anything you want, and I'll give an honest answer. It can be sexual, awkward, weird, or even nosey. I can't think of anything that I wouldn't be happy to talk about.

title: It's really hard to rise above the rest of the creeps
text:
Dating is hard. Trying to push yourself to meet a young lady is difficult because in the world of online dating, you have a bunch of creepy men flaunting their chops at a multitude of women overwhelmed by their number of prospects all the while being discouraged and frustrated at the continuous growth male mental midgetry. I have come to lean on online dating, whether it concerns craigslist or an online dating site. That said, I've decided to swing for the fences. How can I stand out from the rest of the creeps? I feel as though I have a lot to offer, but getting someone to give you a chance is a large hump to get over. Send someone a message. Who knows if she will even read it? Not a simple "hi" or "You're hot" but legitimate well thought out message that might make her do a double take. 

Love is a semi-myth. It seems like becoming a billionaire would take less time and less sweat. I have loved two women in my life, and it took two years to determine that's how I felt. So what am I doing here hoping for something that can grow from simple roots to one of those Northern California Redwoods, rising so high above the rest of the pedestrian foliage? I would just make this offer: let's talk and be friends. If there is compatibility, you know perfectly well it comes naturally, and if it does come, perhaps we are greeted by a feeling of affirmation that is strong and satisfying that is simply cannot spoken or written.

Still trying to rise above the creeps...

title: I had no idea
text:
There's nothing but misleading ads posted in the "men for women" section; it's full of deception and "click here to verify" corporations trying their damnedest to get your identity. Wow. People have reached for new lows in their career paths.

Is it so clogged up now, that a simple, Norman Rockwell type gent can't even look for a possible introduction with a decent, balanced woman?

It's probably impossible for Craigslist to eradicate the frauds out of a section of the internet, where a man who is lonely, would simply wish to meet a potential new lady, a woman who is also picking up the pieces of her life and starting over. 

Meeting women is not in my normal routine, nor work schedule, nor trust level. I'm withdrawn and gun shy now. Betrayal is a deep wound.

I'd love to meet a night owl..........someone who laughs easily......not some woman who is stone, serious faced most of the time.....someone who laughs at Megamind, or Pixels......someone who likes to wear perfume and has not shortened her beautiful hair, someone who likes to bake cookies and leave them out on the table.......who likes a cup of coffee and breakfast at Cracker Barrel at 7am.......someone who knows smiling ruins a beautiful sexual mood.........someone who likes that I've run them a bubble bath and lit a candle and laid a folded, soft, white robe for them when they're done soaking and enjoying the peaceful incense in the air.......who also loves purple and zipping around the neighborhood on a honda metropolitan, just because~
